[Town Square South.]

The outward appearance of the people here seems a bit classier. Rich clothing and large coin purses are prevalent amongst the travelers. In fact, many of the folk heading into Town Square from the south are accompanied by large bodyguards to assure their safety. The well maintained road is lined with small brass lanterns, each swinging off an individual pole.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* south* west* northwest*.

You follow Kelstar south...

[Southern Avenue.]

Smooth stones make up the street that leads from the center of Spur to the south. Each stone has been carefully fitted for the most comfortable travel by both cart and traveler alike. A well dressed Guard patrols the area in his dress uniform. Captains don't allow for slovenly appearances on this patrol.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Kelstar south...

[Southern Avenue.]

Southern Avenue leads between the center of Spur and the homes of the prosperous and wealthy. Several of the Ladies of the city stroll along the avenue chatting about the current events and latest gossip of the Spur. Behind them, harried servants carry their reticules and all those belongings that they cannot be without.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Kelstar south...

[Southern Avenue.]

Vast estates tower over the huge Spurian wall towards the south. The well-to-do who live in these homes idle away their days, enjoying the luxury of time. Standing next to a very empty lantern pole, a small Flerian child insists in a plaintive wail, that he had nothing to do with the missing lantern. The well-dressed guard that interrogates him keeps pointing at a small sack on the ground and its obvious contents.  An open small burlap sack, a street lantern, and a lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Kelstar south...

[Southern Avenue & Gorey Street.]

The boughs of a large apple tree hang over the well tended avenue. Below the beautiful tree stands a small fountain. Atop the fountain is an intricately carved Secian who appears to be dancing with the water as it splashes around her. Set in the marble base is a small plaque that reads, "For those who have gone before us." Many stand for a moment as they pass this way, giving thanks for the gift of life that is given by both the apple tree and the Secians of long ago. Large piles of dirt and broken stone lay on either side of the street as workmen ready the east and west alleys for expansion.  A street lantern, a closed Secian etched moonsilver door, a pair of open silver forged swinging doors, and a sign above the doors are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: north* east* south* west*.

You follow Kelstar south...

[Southern Avenue.]

Standing next to the large iron gate that separates the center of town from those of the elite class are several of the Spurian Guard. They are here to assist all who pass with the simple kindness of opening a gate, or the more important task of escorting those in need to the bank or market. A young looking cadet rubs wax into the stones of the city wall, his task is daunting, but one that will teach him discipline.  An open iron gate and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: north*.

You follow Kelstar through an open iron gate...

[Gateway.]

An elegant, carved wooden sign hangs above the ornate gateway set into the massive wall that divides Spurs Noble District from the Town Square. You can make out city guardsmen peering down attentively at all that approach from their posts atop the imposing wall. They seem to take a greater interest in this part of town, though there does not seem to be anything threatening enough here to warrant such attention.  A street lantern, an open iron gate, and a gilded silver plaque are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st guard captain.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: south*.

You follow Kelstar south...

[Noble Way.]

To the north, you can make out an ornately scrolled gateway set in the base of the imposing city wall. The refined roadway of Noble Way stretches out to the south. The cobblestones of the road are smooth and even. The attention to detail shown here is a dramatic change from some of the other parts of the city.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Kelstar south...

[Noble Way.]

An unusually large home, even for this part of town, lies off to the west. It seems as if one ambitious owner is slowly buying up the lots next to his and adding them to his own. Groundskeepers are at work in the surrounding gardens, trimming and raking, so intent on their work they do not bother to acknowledge the passing traffic on the road.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: north* southwest*.

You follow Kelstar southwest...

[Noble Way.]

Many grand, even ostentatious, homes line this stretch of Noble Way. Most of the residents here were fortunate enough to be born into the right families. Few that live in this area have ever actually had to work for a living. Glancing at the nameplates reveals many of the recognizable names of the Spur. Some of these names could almost be considered famous.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: northeast* south*.

You follow Kelstar south...

[Noble Way.]

Noble Way continues to wind its way among the rather modestly sized, but elegant, homes of the Spur's successful. Many a peasant farmer may live in homes larger than these, but none can match the quality found here. A peaceful, luxurious feeling pervades this part of town; perhaps it is the drifting floral scents wafting from the well-tended gardens.  A closed elegant black iron gate and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Kelstar south...

[Noble Way.]

Gazing down each of the nearby private drives reveals a glimpse of a luxurious home, each a miniature estate in its own right. Short, stout walls and manicured hedges serve to keep out the riffraff and to protect the small, expensive gardens. Every detail has been attended to display the exotic plants, in all their pampered perfection.  A street lantern and a closed rosewood door are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: north* southeast*.

You follow Kelstar southeast...

[Noble Way.]

Leaving the exceptionally wealthy estates of the Spurian nobility, Noble Way heads toward the Town Square to the northwest. Along the roadside can be seen the in-city homes of successful merchants and other wealthy citizens of the Spur. The homes display a slightly different style, perhaps they are not quite so restrained; a touch more exuberance and freedom with materials is displayed.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: southeast* northwest*.

You follow Kelstar southeast...

[Intersection.]

The avenue comes to a fork, with Noble Way curving from south to the northwest. A side-street heading off to the east leads to an extremely well kept neighborhood that easily surpasses everything around it in splendor and magnificence. Everything, even the carefully pruned trees and the manicured shrubbery displays a desire for elegant perfection.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st mounted city guard, the 2nd mounted city guard, and the 1st bodyguard.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: east* south* northwest*.

You follow Kelstar south...

[Noble Way.]

The entire avenue is composed of fine cobblestone, each level with its neighbor, providing a smooth ride for passing carriages and horses. The stones were customized by craftsmen, cut to order, rather than simply placed wherever they might fit. A few stately oaks and elms line the sides of the road, shading travelers during the daylight hours.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st guard sergeant.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Kelstar south...

[Noble Way.]

Numerous trees lining the avenue serve as the dividing border between the majestic estates of the nobility and the lightly traveled roadway. The estates themselves are noticeably closer to the avenue than those to the south. However, they are no easier to access, still protected by their own guarding walls, some covered with ivy or colorful blooming vines.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.

[Noble Way.]

Occasional gates and driveways lead back into the well-kept estates of the city's nobility, breaking and adding interest to the defining plane of the walls lining Noble Way. The rest of the street seems to mimic the splendor of the estates beyond the wall. Swept and trimmed, the roadway exudes a simple, yet beautiful elegance.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.

[Noble Crossroads.]

A small roadway bordered by flowering hedges bisects the wide avenue of Noble Way at a right angle, heading east to west.  A thick, sturdy sign stands just off to the side of a charming path, its large friendly letters intent on luring travelers into the city's premiere roadstay, the Gilded Lion Inn. The entrance is clearly marked and welcoming, extending off to the southeast.  A wooden sign and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: north* east* southeast* south* west*.

You follow Kelstar south...

[Noble Way.]

Majestic elms continue to line this broad roadway, sheltering the avenue on both sides and further enhancing the grandiose atmosphere. Fronting the beautiful homes, cobbled paths edged with narrow flower beds meander through nearby private gardens. Though they appear wonderful places to spend an afternoon or take a picnic, the glances from those tending the estates makes it clear they are only for the invited.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Kelstar south...

[Noble Way.]

The occasional locked gate marks the entrance to some of the more hidden estates of Spurs nobility. From this broad avenue, little can be seen of their splendor. Behind the imposing gate recedes a proud drive, disappearing mysteriously into the trees. If not for the large imposing tower rising above the hedges it would be hard to discern anything was beyond the gate. It is apparent the residents do not wish to be disturbed.  A street lantern, a closed morbius door, and an open black iron gate are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.

[South Gate.]

A well-guarded gateway separates the city's residential district from the farmlands just beyond. Guards carefully eye all that enter or exit the city, beckoning gruffly to random travelers for a closer inspection. The structure of the guards' barracks is visible above the road to the west. A weathered wooden sign is posted by the gate.  A closed stone gate, a wooden sign, a street lantern, and an open thick stone door are here.

[South gate.]

Through the gate lies the city of Spur, the major center of trade and civilization on the plains. The dusty road leading through the gates is well traveled, and walls of the city are in good repair. A small shack sits to the west of the road, during most times of the day a dusty coach can be seen waiting in front, its horses stomping with impatience to be gone. To the right of the door is a small window, its opening covered with metal bars. An old man, missing most of his teeth, waits patiently for the travelers to pay their fare, and then directs them into the waiting area. On the east side of the road a billowing multicolored tent has been erected, the hustle and bustle of merchants and customers can be seen coming and going at all times of the day.  A rainbow silk tent and an open iron gate are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: south* west*.
The open iron gate slowly closes and locks with a click.

You follow Kelstar south...

[Road.]

Even though it shows heavy wear, the road is in remarkably good repair. It was built by expert craftsmen to withstand the rigors of time and use. Evidence of recent repairs indicate that any problems are dealt with quickly and competently.  Some dried crimson streaks of blood and a broken old wooden trash wagon are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.

[Field.]

A broad strip of grassland that follows the main road east of you, this meadow is often used by the local aristocracy for picnicking and partying on good days. The city guardsmen keep the field clear of riffraff all year round, just to be safe.  A hole is here.

[Gavren Forest, Path]

Large branches hang down from above, casting dark shadows across the forest floor.  With every rustle of the breeze they seem to take on a life of their own, almost to the point of distracting you from the deep ravine that lies ahead, obscured by the gnarly undergrowth.  A mossy rotting log, a crooked crumbling stone bridge, and a dark path are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: None.

You follow Kelstar through a crooked crumbling stone bridge...

[Dark Forest]

You find yourself at the edge of what appears to be an extremely dense forest.  The trees here have grown so tall that they permit no light to break through their expanse.  No plants can possibly grow on the ground in these inhospitable conditions, and only various fungi and lichen seem to be thriving.  Some giant spotted mushrooms and a crooked crumbling stone bridge are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: east* southeast*.

Kelstar returns her blackened serrated mantis blade.

You follow Kelstar east...

[Dark Forest, Spring]

Strange sounds resonate through the hollowness of this forest, and yet it appears to be empty, making you wonder what lurks in the dark shadows beyond.  A small spring gurgles loudly from the ground, the only sign of movement you can detect.  A dirty oozing spring is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st chaos elemental.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: east* south* west*.

>You find something suitably reflective and gaze into it...
You are currently flying at an elevation of 5 feet.


You look like a 1'2" standard adolescent delicate boned, wiry-tough bodied Secian Cleric.
You have very long, wild, kinky white hair with a white streak, heavy lidded pale red eyes, and look translucent.
You appear to be happy right now.
You can be attacked by other players.

On her breast is a small crescent shaped birthmark.

On her neck is a purple marked tattoo of the house of Mandor.

On her belly is a tark tribal circle around the navel.

On her back are glimmering deep Hyacinth wings with draconic runes in Golde upon them.

On her head, behind her left ear is a deep blue Something.

You have no apparent injuries, but look fatigued.
There is a shining gold emblem affixed to your clothing.

Physical appearance:

You see an ageless, tymless, spryte with long wild kinky whyte hair with a glowing whyte streak and sleepy eyes...She is shivering in the cold wind to Valhalla...She has touched the Sky...

>[Dark Woods, Rocky Trail]

The trees are thinner here, as the terrain becomes more rocky.  Boulders lie scattered about, some shattered, from what must have been a long fall from above.  A skeleton lies partially exposed under one of the boulders, obviously a victim of some rockslide.  Perhaps you should take care to avoid the same fate.  A giant corroded granite boulder and a decayed bleached skeleton are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: southwest* northwest*.

[Dark Woods]

Creaking and snapping sounds descend upon you from above.  The darkness makes it impossible to make out anything but the branches immediately overhead.  Perhaps it is just an owl or a bat.  Then again, maybe not.

This area is illuminated.

You follow Kelstar southeast...

>[Dark Woods]

The difference between night and day is minimal, only measurable in degrees of darkness. As you realize that there are eyes peering at you, following your every move, the urge to keep moving along is almost overwhelming.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st dark raven.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: northeast* southeast* southwest* northwest*.
>
You follow Kelstar northwest...

[Dark Forest]

You sense movement all around you, yet you cannot make out the shapes of what lingers in the shadows.  Only occasionally do you glimpse the red, beady eyes that you feel sure are sizing you up.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* southeast* northwest*.

You follow Kelstar northwest...

[Dark Forest]

You find yourself at the edge of what appears to be an extremely dense forest.  The trees here have grown so tall that they permit no light to break through their expanse.  No plants can possibly grow on the ground in these inhospitable conditions, and only various fungi and lichen seem to be thriving.  Some giant spotted mushrooms and a crooked crumbling stone bridge are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: east* southeast*.
h
You have no apparent injuries, but look tired.

HP: 129/129  Ftg:  67/ 72
>
You follow Kelstar east...

[Dark Forest, Spring]

Strange sounds resonate through the hollowness of this forest, and yet it appears to be empty, making you wonder what lurks in the dark shadows beyond.  A small spring gurgles loudly from the ground, the only sign of movement you can detect.  A dirty oozing spring is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: east* south* west*.

You follow Kelstar south...

[Dark Woods]

The darkness seems to go on and on as you find yourself more deeply immersed in this dark wood.  The deeper you go, the more claustrophobic it gets.  It's almost as if the trees are closing in on you.

This area is illuminated.

[Dark Woods]

The tree that looms before you must have once been king of this place.  Though its leaves still are green in some places, it doesn't look to be long before it meets a fate similar to the many dead trees surrounding it.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st gnashing undead lamprey.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.

[Dark Forest]

The trees here are quite different from those that are thriving in the rest of the forest.  The long, leafy branches hang so low that they almost form a wall, blocking your view of anything nearby.  Little patches of light must manage to sneak through here and there, since a few weeds seem to be surviving in what otherwise is a dark, dreary place.

This area is illuminated.

Obvious paths: northeast* northwest*.

[Dark Forest, Mossy Grotto]

The wall of leaves to the southeast seclude this grotto from the rest of the forest, yet they are still the easiest way in and out of here, since a sturdy wall prohibits you from making any further progress to the northwest.  A large stone in one wall appears to have some etchings in it, but is so weathered and so covered in white moss that the markings are now indecipherable.  A mossy stone wall and an opening in the wall are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: southeast*.

[Dark Woods]

The difference between night and day is minimal, only measurable in degrees of darkness. As you realize that there are eyes peering at you, following your every move, the urge to keep moving along is almost overwhelming.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: northeast* southeast* southwest* northwest*.

Dalton leans on Kelstar's calf and draps and arm around behind her leg, holding her close.

You follow Kelstar southeast...

[Dark Woods]

Creaking and snapping sounds descend upon you from above.  The darkness makes it impossible to make out anything but the branches immediately overhead.  Perhaps it is just an owl or a bat.  Then again, maybe not.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: northeast* southeast* northwest*.

[Dark Woods, Rocky Trail]

The trees are thinner here, as the terrain becomes more rocky.  Boulders lie scattered about, some shattered, from what must have been a long fall from above.  A skeleton lies partially exposed under one of the boulders, obviously a victim of some rockslide.  Perhaps you should take care to avoid the same fate.  A giant corroded granite boulder and a decayed bleached skeleton are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: southwest* northwest*.

You follow Kelstar northwest...

[Dark Woods, Cliff Face]

You come to an abrupt halt where the face of a huge cliff cuts you off from any further progress. The sheer enormity of the cliff overwhelms you, it's so large you can't see where it begins or ends. Its flat, smooth surface is impossible to climb, leaving you with no choice but to turn back.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: southeast*.

[Dark Forest]

The trees here are quite different from those that are thriving in the rest of the forest.  The long, leafy branches hang so low that they almost form a wall, blocking your view of anything nearby.  Little patches of light must manage to sneak through here and there, since a few weeds seem to be surviving in what otherwise is a dark, dreary place.

This area is illuminated.

[Dark Forest, Mossy Grotto]

The wall of leaves to the southeast seclude this grotto from the rest of the forest, yet they are still the easiest way in and out of here, since a sturdy wall prohibits you from making any further progress to the northwest.  A large stone in one wall appears to have some etchings in it, but is so weathered and so covered in white moss that the markings are now indecipherable.  A mossy stone wall and an opening in the wall are here.

[Dark Woods]

[Dark Woods, Rocky Trail]

The trees are thinner here, as the terrain becomes more rocky.  Boulders lie scattered about, some shattered, from what must have been a long fall from above.  A skeleton lies partially exposed under one of the boulders, obviously a victim of some rockslide.  Perhaps you should take care to avoid the same fate.  A giant corroded granite boulder and a decayed bleached skeleton are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: southwest* northwest*.

You follow Kelstar northwest...

[Dark Woods, Cliff Face]

You come to an abrupt halt where the face of a huge cliff cuts you off from any further progress. The sheer enormity of the cliff overwhelms you, it's so large you can't see where it begins or ends. Its flat, smooth surface is impossible to climb, leaving you with no choice but to turn back.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.

>[Dark Woods]

Puddles of water cover this low area of the forest.  It seems they have been here for some time, judging by the green slime that covers them.  Some slimy green puddles, a red circle of stones, and a closed shiny box are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: northwest*.

[Dark Woods]

Puddles of water cover this low area of the forest.  It seems they have been here for some time, judging by the green slime that covers them.  Some slimy green puddles, a red circle of stones, and a closed shiny box are here.

This area is illuminated.

Obvious paths: northwest*.

[Dark Woods]

Creaking and snapping sounds descend upon you from above.  The darkness makes it impossible to make out anything but the branches immediately overhead.  Perhaps it is just an owl or a bat.  Then again, maybe not.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Dalton the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: northeast* southeast* northwest*.

[Dark Woods]

Creaking and snapping sounds descend upon you from above.  The darkness makes it impossible to make out anything but the branches immediately overhead.  Perhaps it is just an owl or a bat.  Then again, maybe not.

[Dark Woods]

The scent of pine fills the air, though most of the low branches you see are dead, their needles shed and lying dead on the ground.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Dalton the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: northeast* southwest* northwest*.

You follow Dalton northeast...

[Dark Woods]

There seems to be a break in the dreary darkness, as the trees start to thin out. The surrounding wilderness, repeating ever the same picture of dreary repose, echo the far off trickle of running waters beyond the gloom of impending woods.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st chaos elemental.
In the area is Dalton the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: northeast* southeast* southwest*.

[Dark Woods, Rocky Trail]

The trees are thinner here, as the terrain becomes more rocky.  Boulders lie scattered about, some shattered, from what must have been a long fall from above.  A skeleton lies partially exposed under one of the boulders, obviously a victim of some rockslide.  Perhaps you should take care to avoid the same fate.  A giant corroded granite boulder and a decayed bleached skeleton are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st chaos-infected oak dryad and the 1st chaos elemental.
In the area is Dalton the Noble Secian (flying 20 feet above you).
Obvious paths: southwest* northwest*.

Kelstar, walking with a purpose, just entered from the southwest.

[Dark Woods, Rocky Trail]

The trees are thinner here, as the terrain becomes more rocky.  Boulders lie scattered about, some shattered, from what must have been a long fall from above.  A skeleton lies partially exposed under one of the boulders, obviously a victim of some rockslide.  Perhaps you should take care to avoid the same fate.  A giant corroded granite boulder and a decayed bleached skeleton are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: southwest* northwest*.

[Dark Woods, Cliff Face]

You come to an abrupt halt where the face of a huge cliff cuts you off from any further progress. The sheer enormity of the cliff overwhelms you, it's so large you can't see where it begins or ends. Its flat, smooth surface is impossible to climb, leaving you with no choice but to turn back.

This area is illuminated.

[Dark Forest]

Splinters and broken branches lie scattered across the forest floor, the tattered remains of what must have once been a majestic tree.  As you notice the huge, blackened stump that dominates the area, it is apparent that only a great bolt of lightning could have caused such violent and localized havoc.  A giant charred oak stump is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: east* southeast* southwest* west*.

[Dark Forest, Spring]

Strange sounds resonate through the hollowness of this forest, and yet it appears to be empty, making you wonder what lurks in the dark shadows beyond.  A small spring gurgles loudly from the ground, the only sign of movement you can detect.  A dirty oozing spring is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: east* south* west*.

You follow Kelstar west...

[Dark Forest]

You find yourself at the edge of what appears to be an extremely dense forest.  The trees here have grown so tall that they permit no light to break through their expanse.  No plants can possibly grow on the ground in these inhospitable conditions, and only various fungi and lichen seem to be thriving.  Some giant spotted mushrooms and a crooked crumbling stone bridge are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: east* southeast*.

[Trade Route.]

Several San Elves, shackled at the ankles, stand by the road near the corner of the giant city wall. Two guards eye the chain gang carefully, as a harried Usil engineer pores over a set of drawings. Deep ruts have resulted from the persistent erosion. The San actually enjoy this break from their jail time, snickering quietly as they lean on their shovels and pick-axes.

[Trade Route.]

[Trade Route.]

With a wave and a nod, a Firian guard on the city wall indicates the way is clear.

[Spur Gateway.]

Travelers from Rathan to the northwest, and the Trade Route to the south, converge at Spur's west gate. Guards posted on the ground give those seeking to enter the city a cursory once-over. Their lack of interest shows that anyone approaching has already been observed from above for some time. A grate in the ground loosens mud from wagon wheels and hooves before they pass through the gate, helping to keep the streets of Spur fairly clean.  A closed giant black iron gate, a giant green oak tree, a small blue pool, a thick oak grate over the pool, and a polished stone marker are here.

Many people crowd the narrow Bazaar Path, either heading towards the infamous Bazaar, or forcing their way back towards Trade Way. l
[Locksmith.]

A heavy odor of unwashed sweaty bodies assails you as you enter this rickety establishment. A short Go-blin-al scurries around in the shadows behind the counter. A variety of keys hang behind his counter, establishing this as a locksmith shop. He mumbles, as if to himself, "Heehee ... chests! Lots chests ... yeeees ... picky picky picky! Hee hee! Me unlock 'em, yeeees ... hee hee!"

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious exits: None.
>

A heavy odor of unwashed sweaty bodies assails you as you enter this rickety establishment. A short Go-blin-al scurries around in the shadows behind the counter. You follow Kelstar through an exit...

[The Bazaar.]

A new stall has been hastily constructed on this site, in the shadow of the large Spurian Wall. Most chose to build well within the Bazaar as opposed to this outer path. Low-grade wood and bent nails make up this sorry excuse for a business establishment. A small sign on the front has a crude picture of a key on it, and the name, "Skugz."  A crooked wooden sign, a weathered dark wooden stall, and a broken street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Kelstar north...

[Bazaar Path.]

Two large Oog-ra guards refuse to allow anyone to continue south. With loud gestures and over exaggerated pointing, they send wagons to the east or back north. With some slapping of backs, and happy grins, they congratulate themselves on following directions. A yell is heard from the south as Skugz screams, "Keep meee dooor clear...yes yeees...keep it clear." It is a wonder that he hasn't figured out they are turning away his customers.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: north* east* south*.
put key in clo

You follow Kelstar north...

[Bazaar Path.]

A slinky dressed female San Elf preens and giggles garnering the attention of several humans leaning out the window of the guards' quarters. Catcalls and whistles abound as she shows more thigh then is warranted. A wagon driver, distracted by the view, almost drives into a cart coming the opposite direction. Shouts are exchanged and fists shaken, as the San female snickers at all those involved.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
You place the silver rose shaped key within your rainbow silk cloak.
>
You follow Kelstar north...

[Bazaar Path.]

The foul odor of something that can be almost described as rotted corpses floats in from the east. You hear the cart drivers murmuring something about not eating the pressed cabbage, regardless of how good it tastes. They quickly point to the long line and the overflowing outhouse and wave their hands in front of their faces.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Kelstar north...

[Bazaar Path.]

Bazaar Path follows the line of the Spurian Wall. High above you can hear orders being barked and guards marching in rhythm. The closeness of the wall to the path has essentially blocked any breeze that might waft through the area. The stagnant air holds in the smells of food, incense and lots of bodies. It is not unusual to see the cart drivers with triangles of cloth pulled up over their nose and mouths.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: east* south*.

You follow Kelstar east...

[Bazaar Path.]

Several large carts head west, full of various items the owners are sure will sell for a decent profit. Empty carts, the sign of a prosperous day, head east. An old Thugian pulls and pushes a very stubborn donkey. Neither end seems to be cooperating with his demands. Two small children dance around the Thugian and the donkey, chanting and singing a nasty song. Quickly, he takes out a switch, which is enough encouragement for both the donkey to move and the children to run.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: east* south* west*.

You follow Kelstar east...

[Bazaar Path.]

The foot traffic on Bazaar Path turns south down a small trail into the heart of the Bazaar. Many of the smaller carts follow the buyers and merchants to avoid the conflicts with the larger wagons that continue west. The shouting up ahead quickens the pulse of even the most experienced seller.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: east* west*.

You follow Kelstar east...

[Bazaar Path.]

Deep, muddy ruts mar the road. A trickle of water flows from an unknown source creating a horrid hazard. Drivers curse one another for holding up the flow of traffic. Merchants and buyers carefully pick their way around the hold up, attempting to carefully navigate the slippery ground.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st guard sergeant.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: east* west*.

You follow Kelstar east...

[Bazaar Path.]

Bazaar Path makes a sudden left hand turn, following the direction of the large Spurian Wall. Carts and wagons creak in protest as their heavy loads shift precariously.  Waiting for that rare item to fall from one of the merchant carts, several small Flerian children play in the dust at the side of the road.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: south* west*.

You follow Kelstar south...

[Bazaar Path.]

A break in the traffic shows a small worn path that heads to the west. Many travel that way, sure of their ability to navigate the stalls and tents that create this market place. The larger carts and those not too sure of themselves continue to head north. A small shack sits on the eastern side of the road, its door hanging precariously on its hinges.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st very loud drunk drag-al.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: north* south* west*.

You follow Kelstar south...

[Bazaar Path.]

The going slows down briefly as someone stops dead in their tracks. Every so often one feels the need to take in the sounds and smells that are uniquely the Bazaar. Any slow down in the movement of the crowd creates a loud string of curses. The sellers are eager to get to market to get rid of their goods, and the buyers anticipate their purchases.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Kelstar south...

[Bazaar Path.]

The muffled noises you hear drifting in from the west come out of the Bazaar itself, a veritable hive of activity day and night. An occasional exotic smell is carried by the breeze to tantalize the nose. A large etched window displays tastefully dressed mannequins of many races.  An open sturdy mahogany door and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Kelstar south...

[Bazaar Path.]

Further passage along Bazaar Path is blocked occasionally by brawling peasants. Fights break out over who got here first, who gets to sell first, whose goods are better and who should just pack up and leave. When guards are forced to leave their posts to settle the arguments, all involved lose.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Kelstar south...

[Bazaar Path.]

Many people crowd the narrow Bazaar Path, either heading towards the infamous Bazaar, or forcing their way back towards Trade Way. For a small price, a farmer can rent a booth and directly market his goods. Both some of the best and some of the worst deals can be made within this collection of stalls. The tall wall of Spur looms high to the east, and many of the guards take an early peek into the carts and the goods coming to market.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Kelstar south...

[Trade Way, Intersection.]

A path to the north winds its way among various stalls and tents. Some specialty outlets can be found, provided one does not get lost in this maze known as the Bazaar. More permanent structures to the south suggest finer goods as well as increased security.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: north* east* south* west*.

You follow Kelstar west...

[Trade Way.]

This well-worn road separates the Bazaar to the north and Market Circle to the south. Only a Thugian could appreciate the layered odors of simmering foodstuffs and shoppers from the Bazaar. Crowds of people push past, some brushing against you. It might be a good idea to keep an eye on your coinpurse.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: east* west*.

You follow Kelstar west...

[Trade & Market.]

The buildings of Market Circle stand to the south. It becomes obvious that the area through the arch is a much cleaner marketplace than the bazaar. An inviting eatery stands beside the road, its door open to those weary after a long trip to Spur, as well as those preparing to venture to the great expanses beyond the west gate. A human couple exit the building, arm in arm. A small sign stands beside the intersection.  A sign, an open glossy lacquered oak door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: east* south* west*.

You follow Kelstar south...

[Market Street.]

Situated between the well-traveled Trade Way to the north and the fine shops of Market Circle to the south, this small stretch of road is busy at all times of day. Adventurers with sacks of plundered goods leave Market Street and head west where a shrewd businessman has set up shop in this busy area of the Market District. A small shop stands slightly to the east of the arch leading into Merchant Circle, light shining through its red glass door and illuminating the store front in a cheerful, ruby glow.  A street lantern, an opaque ruby red glass door, and a gold lettered wooden sign are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious paths: north* south* west*.

You follow Kelstar west...

[Side Street.]

A large building sits on this side street. It is sturdily constructed from wood and brick, and bears a sign reading, "Rurik's Trading Post." Various objects line the window display ranging from weapons and armor to random objects you've never seen before. Insistent bartering goes on at all hours.   A pair of open double applewood doors and a street lantern are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st city guard archer and the 2nd city guard archer.
In the room are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious exits: east*.

You follow Kelstar through a pair of open double applewood doors...

[Rurik's Trading Post.]

An Usil trader sits in a corner with a small lamp cataloging and appraising the various items he has deemed fit to buy.  The cluttered shelves are piled so high it's a wonder he can keep track.  You carefully make your way through the armor, weapons and assorted sundries, to the counter.   A pair of open double applewood doors are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Dalton the Noble Secian and Kelstar the Noble Draco.
Obvious exits: None.

[Trade Way, Intersection.]

A path to the north winds its way among various stalls and tents. Some specialty outlets can be found, provided one does not get lost in this maze known as the Bazaar. More permanent structures to the south suggest finer goods as well as increased security.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* east* south* west*.
[Trade Way.]

Many townsfolk pass along this busy thoroughfare. Rich and poor alike mix freely on this street, much to the dismay of a passing nobleman. A young human struggles with an armful of packages and two young children in tow. Those in need of goods or supplies head west towards the market, those looking for the news of the day head east towards Town Square.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* west*.
[Trade Way.]

A large gate separates the Merchant District and Town Square-the hub of Spur's activity. The partially opened gate is currently able to accommodate the simultaneous passage of several locals and visitors, but can be expanded to accept carriages, or sealed to ward against invasion.  Guards stand sentry from atop the wall as well as the ground.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: west*.
go gate
>[Merchant Walk.]

Merchant Walk comes to an abrupt end at a massive moonsilver gate. The towering walls of Spur on either side of the gates force all to pass by the guards who are constantly on the watch for thieves and bandits. Just beyond the gates one can glimpse the bustling Merchant District of Spur.  A gilded oak sign and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east*.
e
e
e
>[Merchant Walk.]

Several city guardsmen have just finished wrestling to the ground some young tough thieves, who thought to rob one of the returning merchants. To one side a relieved-looking Fir Elf gentleman holds on tightly to his gold-tipped walking stick, as the human boy yells his innocence to any who might listen. His pleas fall on deaf ears as the guards drag him away.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st guard sergeant.
Obvious paths: east* west*.
e
[Merchant Walk.]

Merchants, some in frilly finery, others dressed in homespun wools, travel back and forth along this street on their way to and from work. They seem to blend together here, if only briefly. Several of the more haughty looking merchants are trailed by overloaded carts pushed along by haggard young apprentices.   A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* west*.
e
[Merchant Walk.]

A neatly kept park fronts this portion of Merchant Walk. Topiary and low shrubberies partition off small sections of the park. Young lovers sit on benches almost hidden from view, gazing at each other with looks of love, oblivious to the continual bustle of passing customers and merchants on their way to do business.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* west*.
[Merchant Walk.]

Neatly trimmed shrubbery line well-maintained cobblestones along Merchant Walk. Apprentices rush by carrying supplies and orders, carrying out their masters' business. Several wooden benches line the walk for those customers who need to rest from the strain of carrying heavy parcels.  A street lantern is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: east* west*.
hide
[Town Square West.]

People carrying bundles stream in from the west and rapidly lose themselves in the large crowds moving about in the vast town square. Several citizens head west with bulging coinpurses babbling excitedly about what they're going to purchase. Giggling children dart around the slower moving folks rushing on their way to spend the silvers in their pockets.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* west*.

l e
[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.  A flowing white marble fountain, a marble statue of a Human, a shimmering marble statue of a Dragon, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a rosewood sign, and a crisp gold lettered vellum notice are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st wolf (wearing a small gold collar) and the 1st newtling (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Cyclic the Novice Psycian (a newtling upon his left shoulder), Blade the Noble Thugian, Scruple the Noble Drag-al, Greolin the Noble Drag-al, Cieran the Human, and Ormungun the Thugian.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

>[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.  A flowing white marble fountain, a marble statue of a Human, a shimmering marble statue of a Dragon, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a rosewood sign, and a crisp gold lettered vellum notice are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.  A flowing white marble fountain, a marble statue of a Human, a shimmering marble statue of a Dragon, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a rosewood sign, and a crisp gold lettered vellum notice are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Osan'gar the San Elf, Talishia the Leuian, Blade the Noble Thugian, Scruple the Noble Drag-al, Akrataire the Arachnian, Greolin the Noble Drag-al, and Ormungun the Thugian.

>With a click, you unlock the closed iron gate.

[Spur Gateway.]

Travelers from Rathan to the northwest, and the Trade Route to the south, converge at Spur's west gate. Guards posted on the ground give those seeking to enter the city a cursory once-over. Their lack of interest shows that anyone approaching has already been observed from above for some time. A grate in the ground loosens mud from wagon wheels and hooves before they pass through the gate, helping to keep the streets of Spur fairly clean.  An open giant black iron gate, a giant green oak tree, a small blue pool, a thick oak grate over the pool, and a polished stone marker are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: north south southwest west northwest.
The open giant black iron gate slowly closes and locks with a click.

>[West Spur Road.]

The path is flanked by countless tall oaks, swaying peacefully in the wind. They do their best to hide the sky from view, making it hard to tell night from day at times. Littering the area are pieces of broken wagon, bits of human remains and dried splotches of blood. The remnants of a violent fight lie all around you, whomever used to belong to the wagon is no more than vulture food.  A bloody severed foot is here.

>[West Spur Road.]

In the dusty distance, Spur's great wall demarks the southern end of this well-traveled merchant's road. Soaring majestically to the north stands the spiky pinnacles and snow topped peaks of an epic mountain range so immense that it separates lands, races, and cultures. Connecting the two is a merchant road built long ago.

>[West Spur Road.]

The noise and sputum of the big city stains the south eastern horizon through the vague outline of old-growth oaks, maples and cedars. This well traveled road transverses the flat terrain shouldered by weeds and vines and, due to the proximity of the city, small paths continuously cut through the road from either side.

>[West Spur Road.]

Lush grass grows up to the borders of a thick, dense forest that cloaks the hills to the west. The grasslands thin near the grove as the huge trees completely shade the ground, and are replaced by taller bushes and juniper trees. The contrast between the waving stalks on the flat vista and the dark leaves of almost vertical trees is striking.

>[West Spur Road.]

From the west spans a dark green forest of Sycamore and Beech trees that soak in the moister parts of the lower river valley. The tall, shaded forest breaks like a green tinged wave upon the tranquil calm of the grasslands. The huge trees within are ancient, reaching hundreds of feet into the air. As if steaming from a great cauldron, a heavy ground fog seeps from deep within the forest carrying with it the fresh smell of decomposing green matter.

[West Spur Road.]

A rickety criss-crossed rough beam fence pens the grazing of black and white cows whose ponderous forms are barely visible through the tall grass on either side of the road. To the north, the soft, undulating grassland floor of the wide valley succumbs to the rolling foothills, which in turn delineates the imposing outline of a vista-spanning mountain range. Many a traveler has witnessed this idyllic vantage point and has been drawn on to follow the road that travels into the heart of the mountains.

[West Spur Road.]

The road diverts around a small pool of murky water that lies to the north. A confusion of hoof prints muddies the shoreline where the placid bovines have come to water themselves. The pool is damned by a small hillock which allows no drainage so the pool remains stagnant. The mountains to the north reflect in perfectly upside-down symmetry on the still pond's surface, only wavering slightly in concentric circles to the deft touch of small insects.

nw
>[West Spur Road.]

The travel-worn road dips and curves around the low lying foothills. Each pass over the top of hillsides presents a new view of the mountain range. Each dip into small valleys reveal minute eco-systems that exist in each wagon wheel rut where water collects. Splayed avion tracks dot the dried mud in random order permanently recording the hunters conquest of lesser things from the mud and moss.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying 10 feet above you).
Obvious paths: southeast* northwest.
nw
>[West Spur Road.]

Aged and splintered into the vague circular shape, a decaying wagon wheel is left to rot in the grass by the roadside. Their roots protectively sheltered from the weather, idiosyntric sprouts of taller grasses thrive haphazardly inside the wheel. Several tiny holes top small pyramids of sandy debris, where a few red fire ants scout their wagon-wheel domain for fodder.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying 10 feet above you).
Obvious paths: southeast* west.
w
>[West Spur Road.]

As the road bends around a curve, ruts left by merchant's wagons cut so deeply into the mud that all wheeled vehicles are forced to follow the set path. Four loaded wagons of a merchants caravan stand idle as one larger than standard wagon skitters along the path. The buckboard's frame groans and strains to keep it inline while the driver attempts to negotiate the turn. Four dark maned, matched mules balk at the noise behind them, and stomp nervously over the deep ruts. The liveried caravan guards attempt to haul the mules forward, further adding to the mules stubborn refusal to move.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying 10 feet above you).
Obvious paths: east* northwest.
nw
>[West Spur Road.]

The road charges across a flat valley through waving stalks of grain with coppery tinted seeds. Around the northern edge grows a row of huge cypress trees with trunks that measure eight feet across. Debris from the trees' self-trimming mats the taller grasses into an impenetrable wall. The cypresses produce the necessary windbreak for the field to bear the heavy headed grain.

This area is illuminated.

>[West Spur Road.]

The worn merchants road travels the southern side of a low hill in one wide arc. The broad path is slightly banked to accomodate for the turn and incline. On the exposed side of the road, the sturdy road-bed is exposed to the elements and yet has remained solid. A neatly kept plank house with a stone well and fenced paddock overlooks grain fields to the southeast.

w
>[West Spur Road.]

Broadening to fill the lee of a wide valley, the roadway passes by several temporary campsites where caravans have bolstered the existing comforts for their temporary encampments. Neat stacks of foraged sticks and axe-hewn firewood sit adjacent to the blackened rocks of two impromptu fire rings. Freshly dug midden pits waft clues to the camp's frequent use into the clean mountain air.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying 10 feet above you).
Obvious paths: east* west.
w
>[West Spur Road.]

Empty wooden crates, broken harnesses, damaged pottery, and the usual byproducts of food preparation fill an impromptu refuse pile adjacent to two campsites. Both two and four legged scavengers ply through the pile, scattering it further and enlarging the boundary. The result is a landmark of incongruous shapes, colors and shadows along the otherwise bland sweep of grasslands through which the roadway travels.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying 10 feet above you).
Obvious paths: east* northwest.
nw
>[West Spur Road.]

Just to the north, the roadway curves gently around a bend in a large river that flows towards the southeast. An enormous smooth round rock splits off a small eddy from the main current resulting a deep, clear pool by the eastern side of the road. The cool calm water catches the reflection of the white snowcapped mountain range further up the valley while the river rushes past towards Spur. Five fishermen recline on folding chairs or against rocks, tethered by the silvery lines of their poles to the fishing hole. Each fisherman is spread evenly around the pool as if held apart by some invisible barrier as they eye the large shadowy fish shapes finning effortlessly against the mild current in the eddy.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying 10 feet above you).
Obvious paths: southeast* northwest.
nw
>[West Spur Road.]

The raging silver-cast river cuts through the grassland and heads southeast. Fishing boats, bearing the crest of the city of Spur, dart around several barges laden with exotic wares to trade in the merchant city. Most bear the purple livery of the city of Rathan, but every so often a ship flying unfamiliar colors can be sighted.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying 10 feet above you).
Obvious paths: northeast southeast*.
ne
>[West Spur Road.]

The metal grey river deposits a sandbar on its western bank near the merchant road, causing a snag of dead logs, branches and floating debris. A cat sized rodent, with long teeth, flat tail and webbed toes peaks briefly over the jumbled tangle of branches before dipping back into the frigid water without a splash.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying 10 feet above you).

n
>[West Spur Road.]

Built to withstand the constant flooding of the large river, the roadbed here was constructed 3 feet higher then the rest of the valley floor. The competant engineers extended the berm further northwest until it became the footings of a stalwart rock bridge.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying 10 feet above you).
Obvious paths: south* northwest.
nw
>[Silver River Bridge.]

The massive stone bridge expands over the raging river, it's huge pilons buried deep in the river's bottom. Within sight and just downstream, the water rushes past what remains of the old bridge, causing dangerous under-currents. Bright red bouys mark the broken fragments locations and signs tell of the peril. The river pilots earn their pay negotiating this treacherous obstacle.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying 10 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north southeast*.
n
>[Silver River Bridge.]

The huge stone bridge span was built tall to allow the various merchant ships to pass underneath. This amazing height affords a splendid view of the countryside: from the blur of smoky residential air to the southeast, across the verdant grasslands that cover the foothills, to the majestic peaks of the mountain range to the north.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying 10 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north south*.
n
>[Silver River Bridge.]

The river surges strongly below the stone span. Even from this height, the noise of the flowing water is near deafening. Two small fishing boats nearly collide as they try to tack between the same set of supports. Only skillful sailing prevents them from hitting each other, or the supports.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying 10 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north south*.
n
>[Silver River Bridge.]

In the middle of the stone bridge's span, a carved stone plaque is set into the masonry of the rock wall. Worked black marble bears a likeness of a San Elf and a brief warning describing her and her crimes against the merchants who depend on this bridge for their livelihood.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying 10 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north south*.
n
>[Silver River Bridge.]

Mismatched mortar colors and varying types and cuts of the stone show the extent of the reconstruction made by quick working masons. A few proud workers chiseled their initials and the date into their handiwork, most reading the date of Rinannimas, 6th month, 61st day, year 313. Bright banners flutter in the breeze on both sides of the bridge as if in celebration of its victory over both the river's truculence and sabotage.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying 10 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north south*.
n
>[Silver River Bridge.]

A massive stone bridge spans a raging grey tinted river as it runs it's course towards the southeast. The mud around the bridge footings has been churned by wheels of quarry wagons, tracks of sleds bearing block and tackle, shod hooves of draft beasts and booted feet of masons and bridge workers. The newer parts of the huge bridge are obvious due to the contrast in colors of mortar and rock. Bright banners snap briskly in the wind from both ends of the bridge.  A broken wooden wagon is here.

This area is illuminated.

nw
>[North Bridge Trail.]

Withstanding seasonal floods and constant traffic, the durable road shows how affective good design and competent construction can be. It travels a hand paved berm straight to an imposing grey stone bridge to the southeast. The pilons of the bridge are cloaked in river mist as the raging river sweeps by. Only the brightness of the fluttering flags that top the spans stand out sharply.

This area is illuminated.

>[North Bridge Trail.]

A brown and white osprey soars above the raging river, scanning the water for a meal. Suddenly, it dives down to the surface and snatches a rather large trout from the water. The trout wriggles helplessly in the large birds grip as it is carried off to a nest of sticks and twigs high in the distant treetops.

>[North Bridge Trail.]

On the northern edge of the road stands a tall, flat rock. Chipped into the shape of a pillar and abraded to smoothness, it bears the stamped surveyor's mark of the road's builder. The mark's grooved letters are filled with sand and dust and obscured from age, but the arrows delineating north, south, east and west are clear and easy to read. The rest of the stamp is undecipherable and lends mystery to the road's origin.

This area is illuminated.

>[North Bridge Trail.]

Boulders stacked in pyramids contained by large timbers stand mutely to the side of the roadway next to an impromptu dump of broken tools, wooden stakes and empty buckets lined with mortar. Deeply grooved sled tracks lead to the east towards the bridge from this part of the road where the flatness of the valley was best suited for the staging area during the bridge's reconstruction. Smooth rectangles of tent foundations still mark their location in a semi circle around a blackened fire ring where the workers and their supervisors lived during it's rebuilding.

>[North Bridge Trail.]

The decaying remains of the bridge workers camp sprawls across this flat valley. To house their draft beasts, the workers constructed small stalls and shelters from rickety boards nailed quixotically to the standing trees. Three brass ring topped posts lie sunk into the grasslands turf, to the south, which was most likely used for tethering grazing animals. Between the posts is a rough stone trough that is filled automatically with water by a rickety mechanical wind mill, whirling lazily in the breeze.

[North Bridge Trail.]

Water loving trees hug the river's course through the low lying valley. Giant beech and huge alders vie for the valuable sodden shoreline and shade the understory bushes and ferns from direct sunlight. The result is a lushly green, verdant forest that obscures the river from the view on the road, though the hiss of rushing water reveals it's course.

This area is illuminated.

Obvious paths: southeast* west.
w
>[North Bridge Trail.]

Running parallel to the road is a smooth rock lined trench that channels the road's run-off during rainstorms. This flat part of the road that follows the valley floor would be prone to turn into a muddy bog and therefore a hazard to most caravans and their pack animals. Anticipating this event, the road's engineers built drains into the lower side of the road that carry the runoff into the culvert, which carries it harmlessly down to the low end of the valley.

This area is illuminated.

>[North Bridge Trail.]

With the care and attention to detail rarely given to a mundane project such as a road, the engineers foresaw potential hazards and built the solutions into their finished project. Tracking the southern, downhill side of the road is a stone lined trough meant to solve any flooding or mud related issues.

Large gout-like burls disfigure some of the wide, grey trunks which have grown quietly next to the road for hundreds of years.

>[North Bridge Trail.]

The merchant road follows a bumpy path through the oak forest. Each stately old tree has added a few feet to it's girth since the road was first surveyed and constructed hundreds of years ago. Their roots have plied across the road, upending it's hand laid foundation and hand pounded bed. Several large knees of the oak's roots have leveraged up the edges of the road, hindering all wagons' passage and threatening to break spokes and axles.

The pool's overflow creates a single clear stream that meanders towards the ancient oak forest.

>[Tarath Fault.]

The engineers set a route as far as possible from the broken stones in the center of the valley and, by luck or design, this foresight has saved the road-bed from constant reconstruction. Small cracks run parallel to the road, but none have broken through the thick layers of sand and stone.

>[Tarath Fault.]

>[Tarath Fault.]

>[Tarath Bends.]

The rocky valley walls widen to the accommodate the splitting of the Tarath fault line. The Great Divide towers to the north beyond the fractured, broken badlands. >[Tarath Bends.]

The trembling fault line reveals the cataclysmic trauma of the solid bedrock beneath the mountains. Striations of tortured, twisted rock bent almost in half under the strain stand out dramatically against darker, older layers of bedrock.

w
>[Tarath Bends.]

A short tremor suddenly rocks the cracked merchant road! A dusty pall sifts into the air from cracks in the ground and the shifting of gravel around the valley.  The tremor rolls through the canyon walls like a ripple, as if it were a linen sheet that was lifted and settled again. Pack animals and travelers alike stop momentarily and then hasten their pace as if to leave the quake behind them.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: east* west.
w
>[Tarath Bends.]

As the merchant road approaches the western end of the valley, the valley wall abruptly falls away to a sheer drop. Crumbling rock and dirt spill constantly into the deep abyss. Sections of the mountain have slid away into the valley and the merchant road has been rebuilt higher along the steeper sides of the mountain. The fault line of broken rocks continues its path of destruction to the west, skirted by the land-slide prone softer dirt.   A freshly uncovered crevice and a gleaming tiger's eye quartz marble are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st lizardman and the 2nd lizardman.

[Tarath Bends.]

As the merchant road approaches the western end of the valley, the valley wall abruptly falls away to a sheer drop. Crumbling rock and dirt spill constantly into the deep abyss. Sections of the mountain have slid away into the valley and the merchant road has been rebuilt higher along the steeper sides of the mountain. The fault line of broken rocks continues its path of destruction to the west, skirted by the land-slide prone softer dirt.   A freshly uncovered crevice is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.

The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

A treacherous dusty trail leads west along the shaky fault line from a fork in the main road. The original roadbed has fallen into the chasm years ago, leaving the merchants to their own wiles to ply the slippery slopes past the fault zone. Many attempts have failed at conquering the shifting dirt and rocks. Currently a bumpy trail skirts the bigger rocks and loose gravel. 

This area is illuminated.

[Tarath Bends.]

A short tremor suddenly rocks the cracked merchant road! A dusty pall sifts into the air from cracks in the ground and the shifting of gravel around the valley.  The tremor rolls through the canyon walls like a ripple, as if it were a linen sheet that was lifted and settled again. Pack animals and travelers alike stop momentarily and then hasten their pace as if to leave the quake behind them.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.

l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

The rocky valley walls widen to the accommodate the splitting of the Tarath fault line. The Great Divide towers to the north beyond the fractured, broken badlands. Sheer, monolithic cliffs dropping for thousands of feet front the western edge of the mountains; their sharp, snow-capped peaks vaulting nearly vertically from the floor of the fault line valley. The merchant road bed is cracked and broken as it negotiates the larger twists and turns.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st caravan guard.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).
Obvious paths: southeast northwest*.

[Tarath Bends.]

A short vibration shudders the roadbed, causing dust and gravel to shimmy down the canyon walls. A few larger rocks ping and ricochet off boulders, until all is deadly silent.  The merchant road is dusted with bits of broken rock, covering any recent tracks. 

This area is illuminated.

The area brightens.
[Tarath Fault.]

The momentous forces that have wrought this valley still press upon the land and have done so for eons.  The walls of the valley are sheer and steep, and untouched by the raging waters of river or stream.  As if in testimony to the power of the forces that move the land, a huge dark boulder sits off to the side of the road. It is hewn in half like a sliced melon.  One part sits 20 feet north along the break in the rocks from the other part.  

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).

The area brightens.
[Tarath Fault.]

One layer of rock in the steep walls has eroded faster then the harder granite or bedrock above and below it. Soft sandstone has been stripped away to form an arch in the valley wall ... a concave indention that goes for hundreds of feet in both directions.  Within the hardened sediment left ages ago upon the land are treasures beyond value: fossilized shells by the thousands, in all sizes, shapes and colors.

This area is illuminated.

The area brightens.
[Tarath Fault.]

The merchant road threads through bottom of the small, narrow valley. Sheer granite walls block the view from the well traveled road to either side and above, only a narrow ray of sky testifies to the time of day. The engineers set a route as far as possible from the broken stones in the center of the valley and, by luck or design, this foresight has saved the road-bed from constant reconstruction. Small cracks run parallel to the road, but none have broken through the thick layers of sand and stone.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying 15 feet above you).

The area brightens.
[Tarath Fault.]

The sandy soil of the steppe has been ripped away to reveal its intimate underpinnings.  The matted roots of the prairie grasses desperately hold into what little dirt they can while below in wide layers, the rocks and dirt tell the story of the plateau and the surrounding foothills. Each striation varies in texture, composition and color. They are an open book for those with the specific knowledge to read it.

This area is illuminated.

[North Bridge Trail.]

Protected by an outcropping of the rocks that tops another high hill, an oasis of vibrant green mosses reveal a small spring that barely dampens the rocky soil. The granite basin holds only enough water to fill a few waterbags.

The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The merchant road tops a low swell in the dusty green grass ocean of the dry steppe. From here, it is possible to observe an astounding 360 degree vista of the towering mountains to the north, the thick oak forest to the southeast, and more dry grasslands to the south and west. The terrain buckles and bends towards the north like a giant rug of trees and rocks had been pushed towards a wall of solid rock.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying beside you).
Obvious paths: north* southwest.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The merchant road tops a low swell in the dusty green grass ocean of the dry steppe. From here, it is possible to observe an astounding 360 degree vista of the towering mountains to the north, the thick oak forest to the southeast, and more dry grasslands to the south and west. The terrain buckles and bends towards the north like a giant rug of trees and rocks had been pushed towards a wall of solid rock.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying beside you).
Obvious paths: north southwest.
>
You follow Msanychta southwest...


l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

A brisk wind barrels down from the mountains to the north, its touch filled with the promise of ice and snow. As it passes the dry road-bed, it mixes with the warm moist air of the river valley that creeps north and causes dust dervishes that spin their opaque bodies thousands of feet into the air. The sharp bladed grasses shiver and swirl as the tiny twisters weave their way across the steppe.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying beside you).
Obvious paths: northeast* southwest.
[North Bridge Trail.]

A brisk wind barrels down from the mountains to the north, its touch filled with the promise of ice and snow. As it passes the dry road-bed, it mixes with the warm moist air of the river valley that creeps north and causes dust dervishes that spin their opaque bodies thousands of feet into the air. The sharp bladed grasses shiver and swirl as the tiny twisters weave their way across the steppe.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying beside you).
Obvious paths: northeast southwest.
>
You follow Msanychta southwest...


l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Game trails cut back and forth across the merchants road covered with the split, sharp toed hoof prints of deer and elk. Dark spoor mark the trails most frequently used by the herbivores: the hunted. Sharp yipping pierces the cold, quiet air from both sides of the road: the hunters. The widely spaced junipers, scrub oaks, and mountain hawthorns offer ample cover for the pack of wolves to range unseen through the plateau.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying beside you).
Obvious paths: northeast* south.
[North Bridge Trail.]

You follow Msanychta south...


l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Blending perfectly with the muted hues of the arid surroundings, a lone timber wolf stalks the outer edges of the grassland about a half a mile from the merchant road. The wolf's ears are perked to listen for the rustling of the bushy tailed jack rabbits that thrive in the prairie. The wolf lifts it nose to catch a scent, howls briefly and trots off towards the southeast to catch it's prey from downwind.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying beside you).
Obvious paths: north* southwest.
[North Bridge Trail.]

You follow Msanychta southwest...


l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Bright green trees and healthy bushes stand out sporadically on the dusty steppe. The little spring fed islands are surrounded by the blue-green grasses that thrive here. All manner of beasts are drawn to the springs and the protection they offer. Bright blue scrub jays chatter noisily among themselves as they dart and swerve in accomplished aerial feats pursuing their winged insect meals. A small herd of wary jackrabbits stop munching the grass to turn their white ears towards the merchant road. The nearest jack to the road stands on his hind legs and tests the air for any scent of their many predators.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying beside you).
Obvious paths: northeast* south.
[North Bridge Trail.]
