l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Thicker stalked grasses grow here on this high plateau where the air is rarified and rain spills quickly down the small rocky gullies. A few staunch oaks grow alone or in groups of one or two, their roots exposed where they cling to the rocky soil for sustenance. Thin, scraggly junipers suck up what little moisture the soil does manage to hold. The merchant road placidly passes by, untouched by time in the dry environment.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying beside you).
Obvious paths: north* southwest.
[North Bridge Trail.]

>
You follow Msanychta southwest...


l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The merchant road swerves around a rock strewn hill. Several ancient oak trees grow in solitary wonder on the south side of the hill. Dead fall and broken branches cover the hollow and is home for a family of thick furred marmots. The dark brown colored rodents stare out of the dark recesses of the dead branches with shiny black eyes. A brace of buck-toothed, adolescent marmots scramble for cover as the shrill cry of a hawk sounds further up the mountain.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying beside you).
Obvious paths: northeast* southwest.

You follow Msanychta southwest...


l
The area brightens.
[Twin Creeks Crossing.]

To the southeast, two streams trickle from the north and pass directly under the roadbed. The twin streams combine as they travel down the hill to make a picture-perfect waterfall rimmed by delicate maidenhair ferns and bright green moss. The little riverlet from the pool then flows into an ancient oak forest further southeast.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying beside you).
Obvious paths: northeast* southeast.

l
The area brightens.
[Twin Creeks Crossing.]

Hand pounded concrete pipes, half circle in shape, channel two small streams under the chinked rock and gravel road-bed. The icy spring water bubbles down the hill and glides over a sheet of shorn granite until it fills a crystal clear pool at the bottom, far below the road. The pool's overflow creates a single clear stream that meanders towards the ancient oak forest.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying beside you).
Obvious paths: east northwest*.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The high steppe grasslands yields to a green wall of oak trees to the southeast. The oak forest is very old, the greying trunks of the behemoths are cracked and split. The road immediately darkens under the canopy of the green leaves. Pale green bracken ferns grow tall in the eternal twilight shade. Flat, yellow capped mushrooms and rippled shelf fungi sprout from the fallen trees. The pleasant aroma of healthy decomposing leaves fills the air.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying beside you).
Obvious paths: southeast west*.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The merchant road takes a large bend as it travels through the dark woodland. Venerable, wide-trunked oaks line the merchant road and the trunks of the closest ones have been marked by the passage of thousands of travelers and adventurers. Some have carved their initials, some, a picture of loved ones or body parts of odd proportions, and some, the date they passed by.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying beside you).
Obvious paths: southwest northwest*.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Off to the side of the road, perhaps a hundred feet away, stands an enormous tree that commands the attention of all who pass this direction. It's offspring populate the plateau for miles in both directions. At one time, the tree must have stood alone on the prairie soil and dropped acorns year after year until one tree became a huge forest of oaks.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying beside you).
Obvious paths: northeast* southwest.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The merchant road follows a bumpy path through the oak forest. Each stately old tree has added a few feet to it's girth since the road was first surveyed and constructed hundreds of years ago. Their roots have plied across the road, upending it's hand laid foundation and hand pounded bed. Several large knees of the oak's roots have leveraged up the edges of the road, hindering all wagons' passage and threatening to break spokes and axles.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying beside you).
Obvious paths: northeast* southwest.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The merchant road makes a wide turn as it passes through the thick oak forest. A tiny meadow with a murmuring creek is the only open spot in sight. Bright wildflowers and fragrant mosses crowd around a sparkling jewel of a pond while the huge oaks stand like sentinels around the edges. A spotted fawn and its doe-eyed mother drink cautiously, swishing their white edged tails quickly.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying beside you).
Obvious paths: northeast* west.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Crunching loudly on the road is a ankle high deposit of acorn hulls and their discarded caps. Quick footed grey squirrels dash across the road, or above on the high intertwined branches of the stately oaks, with the highly coveted acorns grasped firmly in their teeth. The squirrels flash their tails at each other in some unknown signal as traffic passes on the road.  A pile of empty acorn caps is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying beside you).
Obvious paths: east* southwest.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The grassland plateau is embraced by a stand of dark green oak trees so thick that little light passes through the profusion of their many lobed leaves. The forest is ancient and the trunks of the trees bare witness to fires, lightning strikes and the attacks of insects. Large gout-like burls disfigure some of the wide, grey trunks which have grown quietly next to the road for hundreds of years.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying beside you).
Obvious paths: northeast* west.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The merchant roads widens as it travels another grass swept plateau. The mountain range fills the northern skyline in stark detail. Huge snow capped peaks and rough faced cliffs are close enough to see the individual boulders, waterfalls, and haphazard game trails. Much higher up the great mountainsides a line where trees stop growing gives testament to the altitude. The air is cool.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying beside you).
Obvious paths: east* west.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The roadway takes advantage of a cut in the hill to negotiate a tumbled cliff face. At the top of the hill is a high, flat, steppe grassland, and at the bottom is the edge of the open range. At one point, the road narrows to cross a small stream. Very little mud gathers in the shallows of the stream and the pebbles and rocks glitter like gold as the wagon wheels churn the gravel.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying beside you).
Obvious paths: east* southwest.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

White barked birch trees populate the moist valleys that drain into the river to the southeast as the merchant road passes nearby. The tall vertical trees reach to the sky in a beautiful dance reminiscent of dancers waving their arms gracefully to some unheard rhythm. The grain-laden grasses sway in accompaniment, and the tinkling waterfalls and babbling creeks beat like odd syncopated patterns onto the rocks.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying beside you).
Obvious paths: northeast* south.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The road crests the top of hill overlooking the sweeping grasslands of the river valley. A smokey smudge on the southeastern horizon reveals the location of a large city and the merchant road appears here and there between trees and hills as it travels to market. The roar of the great river drones in the distance.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying beside you).

[North Bridge Trail.]

The merchant road passes through a small secluded valley. The soft cadence of rushing water echoes quietly down the vale where the rolling hills of the grasslands meets the sharper cliffs of the foothills. Riverlets and streams trickle down the rock faces adding harmony to a distant river's melody.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying beside you).

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

With the care and attention to detail rarely given to a mundane project such as a road, the engineers foresaw potential hazards and built the solutions into their finished project. Tracking the southern, downhill side of the road is a stone lined trough meant to solve any flooding or mud related issues.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying beside you).
Obvious paths: east west*.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Running parallel to the road is a smooth rock lined trench that channels the road's run-off during rainstorms. This flat part of the road that follows the valley floor would be prone to turn into a muddy bog and therefore a hazard to most caravans and their pack animals. Anticipating this event, the road's engineers built drains into the lower side of the road that carry the runoff into the culvert, which carries it harmlessly down to the low end of the valley.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st foreign merchant.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying beside you).
Obvious paths: east west*.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Water loving trees hug the river's course through the low lying valley. Giant beech and huge alders vie for the valuable sodden shoreline and shade the understory bushes and ferns from direct sunlight. The result is a lushly green, verdant forest that obscures the river from the view on the road, though the hiss of rushing water reveals it's course.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying beside you).
Obvious paths: southeast west*.
[North Bridge Trail.]

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The decaying remains of the bridge workers camp sprawls across this flat valley. To house their draft beasts, the workers constructed small stalls and shelters from rickety boards nailed quixotically to the standing trees. Three brass ring topped posts lie sunk into the grasslands turf, to the south, which was most likely used for tethering grazing animals. Between the posts is a rough stone trough that is filled automatically with water by a rickety mechanical wind mill, whirling lazily in the breeze.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying beside you).
Obvious paths: east northwest*.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Boulders stacked in pyramids contained by large timbers stand mutely to the side of the roadway next to an impromptu dump of broken tools, wooden stakes and empty buckets lined with mortar. Deeply grooved sled tracks lead to the east towards the bridge from this part of the road where the flatness of the valley was best suited for the staging area during the bridge's reconstruction. Smooth rectangles of tent foundations still mark their location in a semi circle around a blackened fire ring where the workers and their supervisors lived during it's rebuilding.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying beside you).
Obvious paths: east west*.

You follow Msanychta east...


l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

On the northern edge of the road stands a tall, flat rock. Chipped into the shape of a pillar and abraded to smoothness, it bears the stamped surveyor's mark of the road's builder. The mark's grooved letters are filled with sand and dust and obscured from age, but the arrows delineating north, south, east and west are clear and easy to read. The rest of the stamp is undecipherable and lends mystery to the road's origin.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying beside you).
Obvious paths: east west*.

>
You follow Msanychta east...


l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

A brown and white osprey soars above the raging river, scanning the water for a meal. Suddenly, it dives down to the surface and snatches a rather large trout from the water. The trout wriggles helplessly in the large birds grip as it is carried off to a nest of sticks and twigs high in the distant treetops.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st rogue, the 2nd rogue, and the 3rd rogue.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying beside you).
Obvious paths: southeast west*.
[North Bridge Trail.]

A brown and white osprey soars above the raging river, scanning the water for a meal. Suddenly, it dives down to the surface and snatches a rather large trout from the water. The trout wriggles helplessly in the large birds grip as it is carried off to a nest of sticks and twigs high in the distant treetops.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st rogue, the 2nd rogue, and the 3rd rogue.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying beside you).
Obvious paths: southeast west.
>
You follow Msanychta southeast...

[North Bridge Trail.]

Withstanding seasonal floods and constant traffic, the durable road shows how affective good design and competent construction can be. It travels a hand paved berm straight to an imposing grey stone bridge to the southeast. The pilons of the bridge are cloaked in river mist as the raging river sweeps by. Only the brightness of the fluttering flags that top the spans stand out sharply.

This area is illuminated.

The area brightens.
[Silver River Bridge.]

A massive stone bridge spans a raging grey tinted river as it runs it's course towards the southeast. The mud around the bridge footings has been churned by wheels of quarry wagons, tracks of sleds bearing block and tackle, shod hooves of draft beasts and booted feet of masons and bridge workers. The newer parts of the huge bridge are obvious due to the contrast in colors of mortar and rock. Bright banners snap briskly in the wind from both ends of the bridge.  A broken wooden wagon is here.

This area is illuminated.

[Silver River Bridge.]

Mismatched mortar colors and varying types and cuts of the stone show the extent of the reconstruction made by quick working masons. A few proud workers chiseled their initials and the date into their handiwork, most reading the date of Rinannimas, 6th month, 61st day, year 313. Bright banners flutter in the breeze on both sides of the bridge as if in celebration of its victory over both the river's truculence and sabotage.

This area is illuminated.

[Silver River Bridge.]

In the middle of the stone bridge's span, a carved stone plaque is set into the masonry of the rock wall. Worked black marble bears a likeness of a San Elf and a brief warning describing her and her crimes against the merchants who depend on this bridge for their livelihood.

[Silver River Bridge.]

The river surges strongly below the stone span. Even from this height, the noise of the flowing water is near deafening. Two small fishing boats nearly collide as they try to tack between the same set of supports. Only skillful sailing prevents them from hitting each other, or the supports.

[West Spur Road.]

Just to the north, the roadway curves gently around a bend in a large river that flows towards the southeast. An enormous smooth round rock splits off a small eddy from the main current resulting a deep, clear pool by the eastern side of the road. The cool calm water catches the reflection of the white snowcapped mountain range further up the valley while the river rushes past towards Spur. Five fishermen recline on folding chairs or against rocks, tethered by the silvery lines of their poles to the fishing hole. Each fisherman is spread evenly around the pool as if held apart by some invisible barrier as they eye the large shadowy fish shapes finning effortlessly against the mild current in the eddy.

This area is illuminated.

[West Spur Road.]

Empty wooden crates, broken harnesses, damaged pottery, and the usual byproducts of food preparation fill an impromptu refuse pile adjacent to two campsites. Both two and four legged scavengers ply through the pile, scattering it further and enlarging the boundary. The result is a landmark of incongruous shapes, colors and shadows along the otherwise bland sweep of grasslands through which the roadway travels.

This area is illuminated.

>[West Spur Road.]

The road charges across a flat valley through waving stalks of grain with coppery tinted seeds. Around the northern edge grows a row of huge cypress trees with trunks that measure eight feet across. Debris from the trees' self-trimming mats the taller grasses into an impenetrable wall. The cypresses produce the necessary windbreak for the field to bear the heavy headed grain.

[West Spur Road.]

As the road bends around a curve, ruts left by merchant's wagons cut so deeply into the mud that all wheeled vehicles are forced to follow the set path. Four loaded wagons of a merchants caravan stand idle as one larger than standard wagon skitters along the path. The buckboard's frame groans and strains to keep it inline while the driver attempts to negotiate the turn. Four dark maned, matched mules balk at the noise behind them, and stomp nervously over the deep ruts. The liveried caravan guards attempt to haul the mules forward, further adding to the mules stubborn refusal to move.

This area is illuminated.

>[West Spur Road.]

Aged and splintered into the vague circular shape, a decaying wagon wheel is left to rot in the grass by the roadside. Their roots protectively sheltered from the weather, idiosyntric sprouts of taller grasses thrive haphazardly inside the wheel. Several tiny holes top small pyramids of sandy debris, where a few red fire ants scout their wagon-wheel domain for fodder.

This area is illuminated.

>[West Spur Road.]

The travel-worn road dips and curves around the low lying foothills. Each pass over the top of hillsides presents a new view of the mountain range. Each dip into small valleys reveal minute eco-systems that exist in each wagon wheel rut where water collects. Splayed avion tracks dot the dried mud in random order permanently recording the hunters conquest of lesser things from the mud and moss.

This area is illuminated.

>[West Spur Road.]

The road diverts around a small pool of murky water that lies to the north. A confusion of hoof prints muddies the shoreline where the placid bovines have come to water themselves. The pool is damned by a small hillock which allows no drainage so the pool remains stagnant. The mountains to the north reflect in perfectly upside-down symmetry on the still pond's surface, only wavering slightly in concentric circles to the deft touch of small insects.

This area is illuminated.

To the north, the soft, undulating grassland floor of the wide valley succumbs to the rolling foothills, which in turn delineates the imposing outline of a vista-spanning mountain range. Many a traveler has witnessed this idyllic vantage point and has been drawn on to follow the road that travels into the heart of the mountains.

>[West Spur Road.]

The path is flanked by countless tall oaks, swaying peacefully in the wind. They do their best to hide the sky from view, making it hard to tell night from day at times. Littering the area are pieces of broken wagon, bits of human remains and dried splotches of blood. The remnants of a violent fight lie all around you, whomever used to belong to the wagon is no more than vulture food.  A bloody severed foot is here.

[Spur Gateway.]

Travelers from Rathan to the northwest, and the Trade Route to the south, converge at Spur's west gate. Guards posted on the ground give those seeking to enter the city a cursory once-over. Their lack of interest shows that anyone approaching has already been observed from above for some time. A grate in the ground loosens mud from wagon wheels and hooves before they pass through the gate, helping to keep the streets of Spur fairly clean.  A closed giant black iron gate, a giant green oak tree, a small blue pool, a thick oak grate over the pool, and a polished stone marker are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Gateway.]

The relative safety inside Spur is a comfort to those returning from the fields and mountains. To those leaving, a massive wall of defense around the city lies ahead. Archer towers beside the gate overlook the wall, offering a painful welcome to would-be invaders. Several guards on foot patrol pass and disappear behind a thick, bluesteel banded steelwood door. Wall road stretches to the south, a wide passage between the city wall and several large buildings.  An open iron gate, an open thick stone door, and a street lantern are here.

>[Trade Way.]

A large gate separates the Merchant District and Town Square-the hub of Spur's activity. The partially opened gate is currently able to accommodate the simultaneous passage of several locals and visitors, but can be expanded to accept carriages, or sealed to ward against invasion.  Guards stand sentry from atop the wall as well as the ground.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying 10 feet above you).
Obvious paths: west*.

[Merchant Walk.]

Merchant Walk comes to an abrupt end at a massive moonsilver gate. The towering walls of Spur on either side of the gates force all to pass by the guards who are constantly on the watch for thieves and bandits. Just beyond the gates one can glimpse the bustling Merchant District of Spur.  A gilded oak sign and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying 10 feet above you).
Obvious paths: east*.
e
>[Merchant Walk.]

Several city guardsmen have just finished wrestling to the ground some young tough thieves, who thought to rob one of the returning merchants. To one side a relieved-looking Fir Elf gentleman holds on tightly to his gold-tipped walking stick, as the human boy yells his innocence to any who might listen. His pleas fall on deaf ears as the guards drag him away.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying 10 feet above you).
Obvious paths: east* west*.

e
e
>[Merchant Walk.]

Merchants, some in frilly finery, others dressed in homespun wools, travel back and forth along this street on their way to and from work. They seem to blend together here, if only briefly. Several of the more haughty looking merchants are trailed by overloaded carts pushed along by haggard young apprentices.   A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying 10 feet above you).
Obvious paths: east* west*.

e
[Merchant Walk.]

A neatly kept park fronts this portion of Merchant Walk. Topiary and low shrubberies partition off small sections of the park. Young lovers sit on benches almost hidden from view, gazing at each other with looks of love, oblivious to the continual bustle of passing customers and merchants on their way to do business.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying 10 feet above you).
Obvious paths: east* west*.
[Merchant Walk.]

Neatly trimmed shrubbery line well-maintained cobblestones along Merchant Walk. Apprentices rush by carrying supplies and orders, carrying out their masters' business. Several wooden benches line the walk for those customers who need to rest from the strain of carrying heavy parcels.  A street lantern is here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Msanychta the Drake (flying 10 feet above you).
Obvious exits: east* west*.
[Town Square West.]

People carrying bundles stream in from the west and rapidly lose themselves in the large crowds moving about in the vast town square. Several citizens head west with bulging coinpurses babbling excitedly about what they're going to purchase. Giggling children dart around the slower moving folks rushing on their way to spend the silvers in their pockets.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st old busybody.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying 10 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* west*.
[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.  A flowing white marble fountain, a marble statue of a Human, a shimmering marble statue of a Dragon, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a rosewood sign, a crisp gold lettered vellum notice, and a broken star shaped bone shield are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st fluffy kitten (wearing a small gold collar), the 1st light colored cat (wearing a small gold collar), and the 1st wolf (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Thistlethorn the Flerian, Anyah the Human, Cieran the Human, Luc the Psycian, and Msanychta the Drake (flying 10 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.
se
se
se
>[Town Square.]

The elegant Hotel Royale towers above the street, its emerald door sparkling in the light. The patrons that stroll in and out are catered to, doors opened and closed for them, and baggage and packages carried by harried servants. The large Bank of Spur sits on the east side of the square. Its location close to the Royale is not a coincidence. A gold-trimmed door is proof of the success of this branch of the Spurian bank and those who run it.  An elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, an open emerald steel door, a street lantern, and a new rosewood sign pointing southeast are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying 10 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north* southeast* west* northwest*.
[Right Street.]

The road between the center of town and the housing district is well kept and maintained. Ruts are immediately repaired and small bushes and flowers line the way. The class of people that travel this way are better dressed and obviously of a higher class. Occasionally guards can be seen taking criminals towards the jail in an efficient and orderly manner.  A street lantern and a pair of closed wide mahogany doors are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying 10 feet above you).
Obvious paths: southeast* northwest*.
[Right Street.]

A polished wooden bench sits in front of a neatly trimmed hedge. It is the perfect spot for those who wish to rest and allow their pets or children to play along the grass fronting the roadway. A small stone well complete with a dipper stands ready to slake the thirst of those who travel this way or who need a breather.  A small stone well and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying 10 feet above you).
Obvious paths: southeast* northwest*.

>[Right Street.]

A neatly trimmed hedge with a small strip of grass fronts the road that travels between the Spurian Housing District and the center of town. A well dressed Frontacian woman hurries along the path as two immaculately dressed Guards lead a criminal towards the jail. She sniffs in a haughty manner, and tips her hat down so she does not have to view the filth of the city.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying 10 feet above you).
Obvious paths: southeast* northwest*.
[Right Street.]

A large wagon sits on the side of the street, its load having shifted and then toppled over. A Usil driver yells at his two Oog-ra helpers, explaining to them that the armoire should be sitting upright and not on its side. They scratch themselves in confusion, and you can hear them muttering something about leaving it on its side, so it does not fall again. There will be a resident who is unhappy with their purchase this evening.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.

[Right Street.]

Right Street ends at a gateway leading to the Housing and Administration District. Those living in this portion of town travel comfortably either by conveyance or by foot. Beautiful flowers grow on both sides of the well tended, freshly painted gate. In front, standing crisply at attention, a Guard tips his hat in greeting to all those who pass.  An open iron gate, a street lantern, and a new rosewood sign pointing southeast are here.

This area is illuminated.

>[Law Road & Shoteron Way.]

Law Road from the south and Shoteron Way from the east join before turning toward Town Square to the northwest. If one stays at this location long enough, they see the irony of these two roads joining. Most who are escorted south along Law Road are the criminals and ne'er-do-wells of the Spur, while those travel along Shoteron Way are the upper class residents whom live further east. Two office building, the City Planners Office and the Archmage's office stand on opposite sides of the road, each one neatly kept and freshly painted.  A street lantern, an open morbius door, and a new rosewood sign pointing east are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake (flying 10 feet above you).
Obvious paths: east* south* northwest*.

[Law Road.]

The colorful city and its multitude of citizens seem to have vanished. The drab, grim grey walls of the buildings that line Law Road are the only things to greet those who travel this cobblestone street. City guards head in both directions, most escorting prisoners to their final destinations in the city jail. The city's clocktower can be seen to the south.  A street lantern, an open neatly painted oak door, and a lettered brass sign above the door are here.

[Law Road.]

The grey monotony of Law Road continues along to the north and south. The buildings along the road here are all offices of local legal representatives. Townsfolk hurry to and from the offices in hopes of avoiding the city guardsmen escorting prisoners to the courthouse and prison in the distance to the south. A loud gong can be heard from the clocktower, its towering height stretching high above the city.  A street lantern is here.

[Clocktower.]

The main chamber of the structure is a powerful image of geometrical perfection. When glanced from one angle the room appears simple, yet from another, the structure takes on a complexity that baffles the eye. The architect behind such a creation must truely be a genius or a madman. To the north a large staircase begins its spiraling ascent around a massive crystalla column at the heart of the tower.  An open drathain door is here.

This room is illuminated.

The area brightens.
[Upper Clocktower, Belfry.]

Thick oak planks run between braces along the inside perimeter of the clocktower walls. From each corner longer and wider boards stretch to the center mechanism where large chain pulleys and thick hemp rope hang down, far below through the open air. Two massive bronze bells hang below the mechanism on giant chains the size of a thick Thugian. A small ladder passes through the ceiling above the center mechanism.  An open colored glass clockface is here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st snarling and snapping orkling.
In the room is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious exits: north south.
[Upper Clocktower, Belfry.]

Thick oak planks run between braces along the inside perimeter of the clocktower walls. From each corner longer and wider boards stretch to the center mechanism where large chain pulleys and thick hemp rope hang down, far below through the open air. Two massive bronze bells hang below the mechanism on giant chains the size of a thick Thugian. A small ladder passes through the ceiling above the center mechanism.  An open colored glass clockface is here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st snarling and snapping orkling.
In the room is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious exits: north south.
>
The snarling and snapping orkling snaps at Msanychta!
The attack misses.

Msanychta ignores the snarling and snapping orkling.

You follow Msanychta south...


l
The area brightens.
[Upper Clocktower, Belfry.]

Dust and dirt falls lightly from the bottom of the unfinished boards in the ceiling. Through the cracks, large shapes can be spied slinking above. Something is dragged across those boards, producing a strange scraping sound.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious exits: north* northeast east.
[Upper Clocktower, Belfry.]

Dust and dirt falls lightly from the bottom of the unfinished boards in the ceiling. Through the cracks, large shapes can be spied slinking above. Something is dragged across those boards, producing a strange scraping sound.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious exits: north northeast east.
>
You follow Msanychta east...


l
The area brightens.
[Upper Clocktower, Belfry.]

The second clockbell, most of it hanging below the wooden planks, swings back and forth on a length of its thick chain. On its side is the stamp of its maker; Nethral Esore. Casting something this massive and then hauling it into place would have been a sight to behold. Seeing it crash to the ground would also be.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious exits: east west*.
[Upper Clocktower, Belfry.]

The second clockbell, most of it hanging below the wooden planks, swings back and forth on a length of its thick chain. On its side is the stamp of its maker; Nethral Esore. This room is illuminated.

diag all

  You examine Msanychta the Dragon...
He appears to be in perfect health.

>
You follow Msanychta east...


l
The area brightens.
[Upper Clocktower, Belfry.]

Large gashes cover the wooden platform at this end of the tower. Even the hardened stone sports a few large scratches and deep chips. Whatever had caused such destruction would have been very large and very powerful.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious exits: north west* northwest.

>You appear to be in perfect health.

HP: 129/129  Ftg:  72/ 72
>
You follow Msanychta north...


l
The area brightens.
[Upper Clocktower, Belfry.]

Stacked timbers lie flat on top of the platform allowing only a hairs breath of room to pass. Metal tools and iron nail spikes sit in heavy leather pouches along the wall. A lone torch sconce, blackened and aged, is attached to the wall. Loud scratching and a thump come from the rooms above.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious exits: north south*.
[Upper Clocktower, Belfry.]

Stacked timbers lie flat on top of the platform allowing only a hairs breath of room to pass. Metal tools and iron nail spikes sit in heavy leather pouches along the wall. A lone torch sconce, blackened and aged, is attached to the wall. Loud scratching and a thump come from the rooms above.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious exits: north south.
>
You follow Msanychta north...


l
The area brightens.
[Upper Clocktower, Belfry.]

A pile of rope, a nest for a few large rats, sits moldy and rotten in the corner. Its frayed, gnawed end drops over the side of the platform and acts as a quick means of escape, if the rats ever get into trouble.  The center gears are easily accessible from this corner, a short distance across the wooden plank.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious exits: south* southwest west.
[Upper Clocktower, Belfry.]

A pile of rope, a nest for a few large rats, sits moldy and rotten in the corner. Its frayed, gnawed end drops over the side of the platform and acts as a quick means of escape, if the rats ever get into trouble.  The center gears are easily accessible from this corner, a short distance across the wooden plank.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious exits: south southwest west.
>
Your glowing swirling multicolored globe flickers for a moment.

Minute coils of violet draconic runemagick circle the end of Msanychta's claws and slowly spiral up his forearms.

Msanychta's forearms are encircled several times by ringlets of fiery violet magick, each consecutive circle rotating in opposite directions.

You follow Msanychta southwest...


l
The area brightens.
[Clockworks.]

Huge gears pass up through the floor and surround this small platform. Every so often one of the large circular toothed mechanisms turns on its axle, keeping the clock running smoothly. Wooden tool boxes sit up against the massive circular center post which runs from the ground and up through the tower's main peak. Cut into the ceiling is a small square hatch, accessible by a wooden ladder attached to the wall.  A weathered pine ladder is here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious exits: northeast* southeast southwest northwest.
[Clockworks.]

Huge gears pass up through the floor and surround this small platform. Every so often one of the large circular toothed mechanisms turns on its axle, keeping the clock running smoothly. Wooden tool boxes sit up against the massive circular center post which runs from the ground and up through the tower's main peak. Cut into the ceiling is a small square hatch, accessible by a wooden ladder attached to the wall.  A weathered pine ladder is here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious exits: northeast southeast southwest northwest.
>
You follow Msanychta through a weathered pine ladder...


l
The area brightens.
[Upper Clocktower, Storage Room.]

Large stone arches permit passage onto the four open-air balconies from this center area. A steady breeze flows through from the north, bringing with it the stench of rotting meat and blood. Grey stone dust lies thickly on everything; boxes, walls, and supplies. Dark black stains run across the floorboards in large rivulets. The dust on some of the crates has been recently disturbed.  Some dusty wooden crates and a weathered pine ladder are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: north east south west.
[Upper Clocktower, Storage Room.]

Large stone arches permit passage onto the four open-air balconies from this center area. A steady breeze flows through from the north, bringing with it the stench of rotting meat and blood. Grey stone dust lies thickly on everything; boxes, walls, and supplies. Dark black stains run across the floorboards in large rivulets. The dust on some of the crates has been recently disturbed. Obvious paths: north east south west.
>
You follow Msanychta north...


l
The area brightens.
[Upper Clocktower, Balcony.]

Puddles of drying blood dot the floor in no discernible pattern. Rotting strips of flesh hang drying, from large hooks attached to the walls and ceiling. Gnawed bones lie in small piles against the cracked grey stone wall at the end of the balcony. Strangely the usual gargoyle statues are not present outside on the sloping roof.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: southeast south* southwest.

You follow Msanychta southeast...


l
The area brightens.
[Upper Clocktower, Balcony.]

The small wall which separates the open balcony from the open air is gone. In its place lies melted stone and a coarse grey dust. Something has caused the long black burns that run along the now charred wooden floor. One sentinel gargoyle sits perched outside, half its head melted away.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: southwest west northwest*.

You follow Msanychta southwest...


l
The area brightens.
[Upper Clocktower, Balcony.]

Two huge stone gargoyles are turned inward and stare down the passage leading to this balcony. Their large grey wings are tucked behind them in an imposing stance, as if ready to spring forward onto their prey. Two humanoid hands have been nailed to the floor under each statue, their purpose unknown.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: north northeast* northwest.

l
The area brightens.
[Upper Clocktower, Balcony.]

A knee high stone wall is the only thing between the balcony and the open air. Giant stone gargoyles perch on either side of the opening, acting as great grey sentinels on top of the tower.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.

l
The area brightens.
[Upper Clocktower, Belfry.]

Dry rot has eaten away at the center of this stretch of planks. Loud creaking emanates from the warped boards with each step, regardless of how lightly they are made. The top of the massive burnished clockbell hangs within reach and sways slightly on its chain.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious exits: east* west.

You follow Msanychta west...


l
The area brightens.
[Upper Clocktower, Belfry.]

The planks lead diagonally to the center or along both inside walls to the east and south. Slimy mold grows along the northern wall oozing a gooey substance from its pores. The goop drips slowly down the stone onto the wooden planks making them slippery to the touch.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious exits: east* southeast south.

Huge gears pass up through the floor and surround this small platform. Every so often one of the large circular toothed mechanisms turns on its axle, keeping the clock running smoothly. Wooden tool boxes sit up against the massive circular center post which runs from the ground and up through the tower's main peak. Cut into the ceiling is a small square hatch, accessible by a wooden ladder attached to the wall.  A weathered pine ladder is here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious exits: northeast southeast southwest northwest.
>
You follow Msanychta through a weathered pine ladder...


l
The area brightens.
[Upper Clocktower, Storage Room.]

Large stone arches permit passage onto the four open-air balconies from this center area. A steady breeze flows through from the north, bringing with it the stench of rotting meat and blood. Grey stone dust lies thickly on everything; boxes, walls, and supplies. Dark black stains run across the floorboards in large rivulets. The dust on some of the crates has been recently disturbed.  Some dusty wooden crates and a weathered pine ladder are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: north east south west.

l
The area brightens.
[Upper Clocktower, Belfry.]

Thick oak planks run between braces along the inside perimeter of the clocktower walls. From each corner longer and wider boards stretch to the center mechanism where large chain pulleys and thick hemp rope hang down, far below through the open air. Two massive bronze bells hang below the mechanism on giant chains the size of a thick Thugian. A small ladder passes through the ceiling above the center mechanism.  An open colored glass clockface is here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious exits: north south*.

l
The area brightens.
[Upper Clocktower, Belfry.]

The planks lead diagonally to the center or along both inside walls to the east and south. Slimy mold grows along the northern wall oozing a gooey substance from its pores. The goop drips slowly down the stone onto the wooden planks making them slippery to the touch.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious exits: east southeast south*.
[Upper Clocktower, Belfry.]

The planks lead diagonally to the center or along both inside walls to the east and south. Slimy mold grows along the northern wall oozing a gooey substance from its pores. The goop drips slowly down the stone onto the wooden planks making them slippery to the touch.

You follow Msanychta southeast...


l
The area brightens.
[Clockworks.]

Huge gears pass up through the floor and surround this small platform. Every so often one of the large circular toothed mechanisms turns on its axle, keeping the clock running smoothly. Wooden tool boxes sit up against the massive circular center post which runs from the ground and up through the tower's main peak. Cut into the ceiling is a small square hatch, accessible by a wooden ladder attached to the wall.  A weathered pine ladder is here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious exits: northeast southeast southwest northwest*.
[Clockworks.]

Huge gears pass up through the floor and surround this small platform. Every so often one of the large circular toothed mechanisms turns on its axle, keeping the clock running smoothly. l
The area brightens.
[Upper Clocktower, Belfry.]

A pile of rope, a nest for a few large rats, sits moldy and rotten in the corner. Its frayed, gnawed end drops over the side of the platform and acts as a quick means of escape, if the rats ever get into trouble.  The center gears are easily accessible from this corner, a short distance across the wooden plank.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st gargoyle.
In the room is Msanychta the Drake.

[Upper Clocktower, Belfry.]

Dust and dirt falls lightly from the bottom of the unfinished boards in the ceiling. Through the cracks, large shapes can be spied slinking above. Something is dragged across those boards, producing a strange scraping sound.  A pair of dark blue supple calfhide gloves and a dirty oak-handled spade are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious exits: north northeast east*.

The area brightens.
[Upper Clocktower, Belfry.]

Thick oak planks run between braces along the inside perimeter of the clocktower walls. From each corner longer and wider boards stretch to the center mechanism where large chain pulleys and thick hemp rope hang down, far below through the open air. Two massive bronze bells hang below the mechanism on giant chains the size of a thick Thugian. A small ladder passes through the ceiling above the center mechanism.  An open colored glass clockface is here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious exits: north south*.

The area brightens.
[Upper Clocktower, Belfry.]

The planks lead diagonally to the center or along both inside walls to the east and south. Slimy mold grows along the northern wall oozing a gooey substance from its pores. The goop drips slowly down the stone onto the wooden planks making them slippery to the touch.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Msanychta the Drake.

The area brightens.
[Upper Clocktower, Belfry.]

Dry rot has eaten away at the center of this stretch of planks. Loud creaking emanates from the warped boards with each step, regardless of how lightly they are made. The top of the massive burnished clockbell hangs within reach and sways slightly on its chain.

This room is illuminated.

The area brightens.
[Upper Clocktower, Belfry.]

A pile of rope, a nest for a few large rats, sits moldy and rotten in the corner. Its frayed, gnawed end drops over the side of the platform and acts as a quick means of escape, if the rats ever get into trouble.  The center gears are easily accessible from this corner, a short distance across the wooden plank.  A gleaming tiger's eye quartz marble and a gleaming tiger's eye quartz marble are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious exits: south southwest west*.

The area brightens.
[Clockworks.]

Huge gears pass up through the floor and surround this small platform. Every so often one of the large circular toothed mechanisms turns on its axle, keeping the clock running smoothly. Wooden tool boxes sit up against the massive circular center post which runs from the ground and up through the tower's main peak. Cut into the ceiling is a small square hatch, accessible by a wooden ladder attached to the wall.  A weathered pine ladder is here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious exits: northeast* southeast southwest northwest.

The area brightens.
[Upper Clocktower, Storage Room.]

Large stone arches permit passage onto the four open-air balconies from this center area. A steady breeze flows through from the north, bringing with it the stench of rotting meat and blood. Grey stone dust lies thickly on everything; boxes, walls, and supplies. Dark black stains run across the floorboards in large rivulets. The dust on some of the crates has been recently disturbed.  Some dusty wooden crates and a weathered pine ladder are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: north east south west.

[Upper Clocktower, Balcony.]

Puddles of drying blood dot the floor in no discernible pattern. Rotting strips of flesh hang drying, from large hooks attached to the walls and ceiling. Gnawed bones lie in small piles against the cracked grey stone wall at the end of the balcony. Strangely the usual gargoyle statues are not present outside on the sloping roof.  A short sleek thin silver stiletto and a closed old tattered vellum encyclopedia are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: southeast south southwest.

l at ga
It looks like an average gargoyle.

It looks like a hulking beast that is gray in color, much like stone.  A demon-like head holds two beady red eyes, and its winged body has horns and projections coming out of it in all directions.
It has a head, 2 arms, 2 legs and wings.

It appears to be near death.
It is bleeding.
It will be very hard for you to hit and it will be hard for it to hit you!

It is also carrying the following item:

  A closed rusting brass chest
  An open patched sack

[Upper Clocktower, Storage Room.]

Large stone arches permit passage onto the four open-air balconies from this center area. A steady breeze flows through from the north, bringing with it the stench of rotting meat and blood. Grey stone dust lies thickly on everything; boxes, walls, and supplies. Dark black stains run across the floorboards in large rivulets. The dust on some of the crates has been recently disturbed.  Some dusty wooden crates and a weathered pine ladder are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st gargoyle and the 2nd gargoyle.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: north east south west*.

[Upper Clocktower, Balcony.]

The small wall which separates the open balcony from the open air is gone. In its place lies melted stone and a coarse grey dust. Something has caused the long black burns that run along the now charred wooden floor. One sentinel gargoyle sits perched outside, half its head melted away.

[Upper Clocktower, Balcony.]

Puddles of drying blood dot the floor in no discernible pattern. Rotting strips of flesh hang drying, from large hooks attached to the walls and ceiling. Gnawed bones lie in small piles against the cracked grey stone wall at the end of the balcony. Strangely the usual gargoyle statues are not present outside on the sloping roof.  A short sleek thin silver stiletto, a closed old tattered vellum encyclopedia, and a closed tattered tigerskin pouch are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: southeast south southwest.
diag all
>
  You examine Msanychta the Dragon...
He has no apparent injuries, but looks tired.

[Upper Clocktower, Storage Room.]

Large stone arches permit passage onto the four open-air balconies from this center area. A steady breeze flows through from the north, bringing with it the stench of rotting meat and blood. Grey stone dust lies thickly on everything; boxes, walls, and supplies. Dark black stains run across the floorboards in large rivulets. The dust on some of the crates has been recently disturbed.  Some dusty wooden crates and a weathered pine ladder are here.

The area brightens.
[Clockworks.]

Huge gears pass up through the floor and surround this small platform. Every so often one of the large circular toothed mechanisms turns on its axle, keeping the clock running smoothly. Wooden tool boxes sit up against the massive circular center post which runs from the ground and up through the tower's main peak. Cut into the ceiling is a small square hatch, accessible by a wooden ladder attached to the wall.  A weathered pine ladder is here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious exits: northeast southeast southwest northwest.

The area brightens.
[Upper Clocktower, Belfry.]

A pile of rope, a nest for a few large rats, sits moldy and rotten in the corner. Its frayed, gnawed end drops over the side of the platform and acts as a quick means of escape, if the rats ever get into trouble.  The center gears are easily accessible from this corner, a short distance across the wooden plank.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Msanychta the Drake.

[Upper Clocktower, Belfry.]

Stacked timbers lie flat on top of the platform allowing only a hairs breath of room to pass. Metal tools and iron nail spikes sit in heavy leather pouches along the wall. A lone torch sconce, blackened and aged, is attached to the wall. Loud scratching and a thump come from the rooms above.

This room is illuminated.

[Upper Clocktower, Belfry.]

The second clockbell, most of it hanging below the wooden planks, swings back and forth on a length of its thick chain. On its side is the stamp of its maker; Nethral Esore. Casting something this massive and then hauling it into place would have been a sight to behold. Seeing it crash to the ground would also be.

l
The area brightens.
[Upper Clocktower, Belfry.]

Thick oak planks run between braces along the inside perimeter of the clocktower walls. From each corner longer and wider boards stretch to the center mechanism where large chain pulleys and thick hemp rope hang down, far below through the open air. Two massive bronze bells hang below the mechanism on giant chains the size of a thick Thugian. A small ladder passes through the ceiling above the center mechanism.  An open colored glass clockface is here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious exits: north south*.

The planks lead diagonally to the center or along both inside walls to the east and south. Slimy mold grows along the northern wall oozing a gooey substance from its pores. The goop drips slowly down the stone onto the wooden planks making them slippery to the touch.

The area brightens.
[Clockworks.]

Huge gears pass up through the floor and surround this small platform. Every so often one of the large circular toothed mechanisms turns on its axle, keeping the clock running smoothly. Wooden tool boxes sit up against the massive circular center post which runs from the ground and up through the tower's main peak. Cut into the ceiling is a small square hatch, accessible by a wooden ladder attached to the wall.  A weathered pine ladder is here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious exits: northeast* southeast southwest northwest.

[Upper Clocktower, Belfry.]

Large gashes cover the wooden platform at this end of the tower. Even the hardened stone sports a few large scratches and deep chips. Whatever had caused such destruction would have been very large and very powerful.

[Upper Clocktower, Belfry.]

Large gashes cover the wooden platform at this end of the tower. Even the hardened stone sports a few large scratches and deep chips. Whatever had caused such destruction would have been very large and very powerful.

l
The area brightens.
[Upper Clocktower, Belfry.]

The second clockbell, most of it hanging below the wooden planks, swings back and forth on a length of its thick chain. On its side is the stamp of its maker; Nethral Esore. Casting something this massive and then hauling it into place would have been a sight to behold. Seeing it crash to the ground would also be.  An open patched pouch is here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious exits: east* west.

l
The area brightens.
[Upper Clocktower, Belfry.]

A pile of rope, a nest for a few large rats, sits moldy and rotten in the corner. Its frayed, gnawed end drops over the side of the platform and acts as a quick means of escape, if the rats ever get into trouble.  The center gears are easily accessible from this corner, a short distance across the wooden plank.  A fluffy blonde wig and a single edged bronze taper axe are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious exits: south southwest* west.

The area brightens.
[Upper Clocktower, Storage Room.]

Large stone arches permit passage onto the four open-air balconies from this center area. A steady breeze flows through from the north, bringing with it the stench of rotting meat and blood. Grey stone dust lies thickly on everything; boxes, walls, and supplies. Dark black stains run across the floorboards in large rivulets. The dust on some of the crates has been recently disturbed.  Some dusty wooden crates and a weathered pine ladder are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: north east south west.

The area brightens.
[Clockworks.]

Huge gears pass up through the floor and surround this small platform. Every so often one of the large circular toothed mechanisms turns on its axle, keeping the clock running smoothly. Wooden tool boxes sit up against the massive circular center post which runs from the ground and up through the tower's main peak. Cut into the ceiling is a small square hatch, accessible by a wooden ladder attached to the wall.  A weathered pine ladder is here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious exits: northeast southeast southwest northwest.

[Upper Clocktower, Belfry.]

The planks lead diagonally to the center or along both inside walls to the east and south. Slimy mold grows along the northern wall oozing a gooey substance from its pores. The goop drips slowly down the stone onto the wooden planks making them slippery to the touch.

[Upper Clocktower, Belfry.]

A pile of rope, a nest for a few large rats, sits moldy and rotten in the corner. Its frayed, gnawed end drops over the side of the platform and acts as a quick means of escape, if the rats ever get into trouble.  The center gears are easily accessible from this corner, a short distance across the wooden plank.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious exits: south southwest* west.

[Clockworks.]

Huge gears pass up through the floor and surround this small platform. Every so often one of the large circular toothed mechanisms turns on its axle, keeping the clock running smoothly. Wooden tool boxes sit up against the massive circular center post which runs from the ground and up through the tower's main peak. Cut into the ceiling is a small square hatch, accessible by a wooden ladder attached to the wall.  A weathered pine ladder and an open baggy bag are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st gargoyle corpse.
In the room is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious exits: northeast southeast* southwest northwest.

[Upper Clocktower, Storage Room.]

Large stone arches permit passage onto the four open-air balconies from this center area. A steady breeze flows through from the north, bringing with it the stench of rotting meat and blood. Grey stone dust lies thickly on everything; boxes, walls, and supplies. Dark black stains run across the floorboards in large rivulets. The dust on some of the crates has been recently disturbed.  Some dusty wooden crates and a weathered pine ladder are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: north east south west.

[Upper Clocktower, Balcony.]

Puddles of drying blood dot the floor in no discernible pattern. Rotting strips of flesh hang drying, from large hooks attached to the walls and ceiling. [Upper Clocktower, Balcony.]

Puddles of drying blood dot the floor in no discernible pattern. Rotting strips of flesh hang drying, from large hooks attached to the walls and ceiling. Gnawed bones lie in small piles against the cracked grey stone wall at the end of the balcony. Strangely the usual gargoyle statues are not present outside on the sloping roof. [Upper Clocktower, Balcony.]

The small wall which separates the open balcony from the open air is gone. In its place lies melted stone and a coarse grey dust. Something has caused the long black burns that run along the now charred wooden floor. One sentinel gargoyle sits perched outside, half its head melted away.

[Upper Clocktower, Storage Room.]

Large stone arches permit passage onto the four open-air balconies from this center area. A steady breeze flows through from the north, bringing with it the stench of rotting meat and blood. [Clockworks.]

[Law Road.]

The grey monotony of Law Road continues along to the north and south. The buildings along the road here are all offices of local legal representatives. Townsfolk hurry to and from the offices in hopes of avoiding the city guardsmen escorting prisoners to the courthouse and prison in the distance to the south. A loud gong can be heard from the clocktower, its towering height stretching high above the city.  A street lantern is here.

[Law Road.]

The colorful city and its multitude of citizens seem to have vanished. The drab, grim grey walls of the buildings that line Law Road are the only things to greet those who travel this cobblestone street. City guards head in both directions, most escorting prisoners to their final destinations in the city jail. The city's clocktower can be seen to the south.  A street lantern, an open neatly painted oak door, and a lettered brass sign above the door are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.

You follow Msanychta north...

[Law Road & Shoteron Way.]

Law Road from the south and Shoteron Way from the east join before turning toward Town Square to the northwest. If one stays at this location long enough, they see the irony of these two roads joining. Most who are escorted south along Law Road are the criminals and ne'er-do-wells of the Spur, while those travel along Shoteron Way are the upper class residents whom live further east. Two office building, the City Planners Office and the Archmage's office stand on opposite sides of the road, each one neatly kept and freshly painted.  A street lantern, an open morbius door, and a new rosewood sign pointing east are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: east* south* northwest*.

You follow Msanychta northwest...

[Gateway.]

You are just inside the gateway between the Justice District and the Town Square. Most of those heading into the Justice District have a grim look about them. Then again, it could just be the chains. A small sign stands off to the side.  An open iron gate, a street lantern, a wooden sign, and a new rosewood sign pointing southeast are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Right Street.]

Right Street ends at a gateway leading to the Housing and Administration District. Those living in this portion of town travel comfortably either by conveyance or by foot. Beautiful flowers grow on both sides of the well tended, freshly painted gate. In front, standing crisply at attention, a Guard tips his hat in greeting to all those who pass.  An open iron gate, a street lantern, and a new rosewood sign pointing southeast are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Right Street.]

A large wagon sits on the side of the street, its load having shifted and then toppled over. A Usil driver yells at his two Oog-ra helpers, explaining to them that the armoire should be sitting upright and not on its side. They scratch themselves in confusion, and you can hear them muttering something about leaving it on its side, so it does not fall again. There will be a resident who is unhappy with their purchase this evening.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.

[Right Street.]

A neatly trimmed hedge with a small strip of grass fronts the road that travels between the Spurian Housing District and the center of town. A well dressed Frontacian woman hurries along the path as two immaculately dressed Guards lead a criminal towards the jail. She sniffs in a haughty manner, and tips her hat down so she does not have to view the filth of the city.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.

[Right Street.]

A polished wooden bench sits in front of a neatly trimmed hedge. It is the perfect spot for those who wish to rest and allow their pets or children to play along the grass fronting the roadway. A small stone well complete with a dipper stands ready to slake the thirst of those who travel this way or who need a breather.  A small stone well and a street lantern are here.

[Right Street.]

The road between the center of town and the housing district is well kept and maintained. Ruts are immediately repaired and small bushes and flowers line the way. The class of people that travel this way are better dressed and obviously of a higher class. Occasionally guards can be seen taking criminals towards the jail in an efficient and orderly manner.  A street lantern and a pair of closed wide mahogany doors are here.

[Town Square.]

The elegant Hotel Royale towers above the street, its emerald door sparkling in the light. The patrons that stroll in and out are catered to, doors opened and closed for them, and baggage and packages carried by harried servants. The large Bank of Spur sits on the east side of the square. Its location close to the Royale is not a coincidence. A gold-trimmed door is proof of the success of this branch of the Spurian bank and those who run it.  An elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, an open emerald steel door, a street lantern, and a new rosewood sign pointing southeast are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* southeast* west* northwest*.

You follow Msanychta northwest...

[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.  A flowing white marble fountain, a marble statue of a Human, a shimmering marble statue of a Dragon, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a rosewood sign, a crisp gold lettered vellum notice, a broken star shaped bone shield, and an open dented gold coffer are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st light colored cat (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Ravenslight the Usil Elf and Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

You follow Msanychta northwest...

[Town Square.]

Two elegant buildings, one to the north and one to the west, stand on either side of a quickly degrading road. Nattily dressed patrons of the two establishments hurry to their destination, not pausing for fear of being robbed, or worse. To the northwest the houses steadily become more decrepit. A dark pallor of smoky air hangs heavily over the area.  A street lantern and a heavy mahogany door are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: east* southeast* south* west* northwest*.

You follow Msanychta west...

[HOD Agent.]

You have entered the somber insurance headquarters of the House of the Dead. Richly appointed furnishings indicate that these services are refused by few. An elegant sign over a massive desk details available services. The presence of some inexplicable power sets your nerves on end. This is no place for hostility.   A wooden sign, a pitch black portal, and a pitch black portal are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious exits: None.

You follow Msanychta through a pitch black portal...

[Trade Way, Intersection.]

A path to the north winds its way among various stalls and tents. Some specialty outlets can be found, provided one does not get lost in this maze known as the Bazaar. More permanent structures to the south suggest finer goods as well as increased security.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* east* south* west*.

You follow Msanychta north...

[Bazaar Path.]

Many people crowd the narrow Bazaar Path, either heading towards the infamous Bazaar, or forcing their way back towards Trade Way. For a small price, a farmer can rent a booth and directly market his goods. Both some of the best and some of the worst deals can be made within this collection of stalls. The tall wall of Spur looms high to the east, and many of the guards take an early peek into the carts and the goods coming to market.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Msanychta north...

[Bazaar Path.]

Further passage along Bazaar Path is blocked occasionally by brawling peasants. Fights break out over who got here first, who gets to sell first, whose goods are better and who should just pack up and leave. When guards are forced to leave their posts to settle the arguments, all involved lose.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Msanychta north...

[Bazaar Path.]

The muffled noises you hear drifting in from the west come out of the Bazaar itself, a veritable hive of activity day and night. An occasional exotic smell is carried by the breeze to tantalize the nose. A large etched window displays tastefully dressed mannequins of many races.  An open sturdy mahogany door and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.

You follow Msanychta north...

[Bazaar Path.]

The going slows down briefly as someone stops dead in their tracks. Every so often one feels the need to take in the sounds and smells that are uniquely the Bazaar. Any slow down in the movement of the crowd creates a loud string of curses. The sellers are eager to get to market to get rid of their goods, and the buyers anticipate their purchases.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.

You follow Msanychta north...

[Bazaar Path.]

A break in the traffic shows a small worn path that heads to the west. Many travel that way, sure of their ability to navigate the stalls and tents that create this market place. The larger carts and those not too sure of themselves continue to head north. A small shack sits on the eastern side of the road, its door hanging precariously on its hinges.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.

You follow Msanychta west...

[Bazaar Path.]

Surrounded by stalls and people, the masses move towards the south. It is virtually impossible to find the small path that got you to this location in the first place. Only those with a working knowledge of the Bazaar can be lucky enough to find their way through it in a timely manner.  A wooden sign and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.

You follow Msanychta south...

[The Bazaar.]

This is the eastern edge of the Bazaar. The various aromas are almost overpowering, the sights unbelievable, and the variety of exotic items unmatched by any place else in the world. The crowd presses in tightly making those who travel here very aware of the fact that taking your eyes off your destination will find you quickly lost.  A red and white applewood sign and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: south* northwest*.

You follow Msanychta northwest...

[Food Way.]

The heavy odor tickling your nose proclaims this the food section of the Bazaar. Foods native to every species can be found throughout the area. Many of the items are unique delicacies, not found anywhere else. A quick glance at a few of them and you are pretty certain you know why. A semi-permanent structure stands to the north of the path. A sign over the door announces the location as Gwollin's Brews.  An open faded walnut door and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: southeast* west*.

You follow Msanychta west...

[Food Way.]

At this intersection many stands display their exotic foodstuffs. Hanging from large hooks are various unidentifiable hunks of meat, and vegetables of all shapes and colors. The only thing more prevalent than the merchants and buyers are the bugs, who clamor to find the most pungent item to land on. To the northeast a small tent can barely be seen hiding behind the stalls.  A white silk tent and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: north east* south* west*.

You follow Msanychta south...

[The Bazaar.]

Moving into the heart of the Bazaar, you encounter a more established shop. The building is sturdier, and built for long term occupancy. The general store has a steady stream of customers, and it serves those young adventurers who are in need of supplies.  A weathered wooden sign, an open faded chestnut door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Msanychta south...

[The Bazaar.]

Guards stand before each stall at this intersection, on what has come to be known as Jeweler's Row. Crowds of customers vie for the finest stones and most beautiful gems. All different manner of merchants hawk their wares as those you should buy. Those who are not careful are just as liable to walk away with a sparkly piece of glass as an expensive diamond.  A bright vellum sign, an open stall, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* east* south* west*.

You follow Msanychta south...

[The Bazaar.]

Standing on the western side of the road is a small stall filled with beakers and assorted philters. Exotic potions of both the mundane and magical variety are being offered for sale. Standing on either side of the stall door are two rather large Thugian guards, the merchant takes no chances with his special concoctions.  A sign, an open stall, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Msanychta south...

[The Bazaar.]

The well-defined Bazaar path heads off to the west. This corner is a mix of the old and the new. On one corner an old stall is barely standing. The roof has caved in, and it quickly becomes apparent that this location has become a local dump. Pieces of wood that look suspiciously like some of the leftovers from other construction sites are piled on top of rotting offal. On the opposite corner a new tent is being erected, its high roof and vivid coloring pleasing to the eye.  An open stall and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.

A long wooden stall is set here between the Bazaar path and the large barracks which house the Spurian guard. Hanging from the front of the rickety wooden roof are furs of every type. You follow Msanychta through an exit...


l
The area brightens.
[The Bazaar.]

A new stall has been hastily constructed on this site, in the shadow of the large Spurian Wall. Most chose to build well within the Bazaar as opposed to this outer path. Low-grade wood and bent nails make up this sorry excuse for a business establishment. A small sign on the front has a crude picture of a key on it, and the name, "Skugz."  A crooked wooden sign, a weathered dark wooden stall, and a broken street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[The Bazaar.]

A new stall has been hastily constructed on this site, in the shadow of the large Spurian Wall. Most chose to build well within the Bazaar as opposed to this outer path. Low-grade wood and bent nails make up this sorry excuse for a business establishment. A small sign on the front has a crude picture of a key on it, and the name, "Skugz."  A crooked wooden sign, a weathered dark wooden stall, and a broken street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
