Msanychta nods up and down.

Msanychta grins.

You follow Msanychta north...

[Bazaar Path.]

Two large Oog-ra guards refuse to allow anyone to continue south. With loud gestures and over exaggerated pointing, they send wagons to the east or back north. With some slapping of backs, and happy grins, they congratulate themselves on following directions. A yell is heard from the south as Skugz screams, "Keep meee dooor clear...yes yeees...keep it clear." It is a wonder that he hasn't figured out they are turning away his customers.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* east* south*.

You follow Msanychta north...

[Bazaar Path.]

A slinky dressed female San Elf preens and giggles garnering the attention of several humans leaning out the window of the guards' quarters. Catcalls and whistles abound as she shows more thigh then is warranted. A wagon driver, distracted by the view, almost drives into a cart coming the opposite direction. Shouts are exchanged and fists shaken, as the San female snickers at all those involved.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st dirty street ruffian and the 2nd dirty street ruffian.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Msanychta north...

[Bazaar Path.]

The foul odor of something that can be almost described as rotted corpses floats in from the east. You hear the cart drivers murmuring something about not eating the pressed cabbage, regardless of how good it tastes. They quickly point to the long line and the overflowing outhouse and wave their hands in front of their faces.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Msanychta north...

[Bazaar Path.]

Bazaar Path follows the line of the Spurian Wall. High above you can hear orders being barked and guards marching in rhythm. The closeness of the wall to the path has essentially blocked any breeze that might waft through the area. The stagnant air holds in the smells of food, incense and lots of bodies. It is not unusual to see the cart drivers with triangles of cloth pulled up over their nose and mouths.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: east* south*.

You follow Msanychta east...

[Bazaar Path.]

Several large carts head west, full of various items the owners are sure will sell for a decent profit. Empty carts, the sign of a prosperous day, head east. An old Thugian pulls and pushes a very stubborn donkey. Neither end seems to be cooperating with his demands. Two small children dance around the Thugian and the donkey, chanting and singing a nasty song. Quickly, he takes out a switch, which is enough encouragement for both the donkey to move and the children to run.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: east* south west*.

You follow Msanychta east...

[Bazaar Path.]

The foot traffic on Bazaar Path turns south down a small trail into the heart of the Bazaar. Many of the smaller carts follow the buyers and merchants to avoid the conflicts with the larger wagons that continue west. The shouting up ahead quickens the pulse of even the most experienced seller.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: east* west*.

You follow Msanychta east...

[Bazaar Path.]

Deep, muddy ruts mar the road. A trickle of water flows from an unknown source creating a horrid hazard. Drivers curse one another for holding up the flow of traffic. Merchants and buyers carefully pick their way around the hold up, attempting to carefully navigate the slippery ground.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: east* west*.

You follow Msanychta east...

[Bazaar Path.]

Bazaar Path makes a sudden left hand turn, following the direction of the large Spurian Wall. Carts and wagons creak in protest as their heavy loads shift precariously.  Waiting for that rare item to fall from one of the merchant carts, several small Flerian children play in the dust at the side of the road.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: south* west*.

You follow Msanychta south...

[Bazaar Path.]

A break in the traffic shows a small worn path that heads to the west. Many travel that way, sure of their ability to navigate the stalls and tents that create this market place. The larger carts and those not too sure of themselves continue to head north. A small shack sits on the eastern side of the road, its door hanging precariously on its hinges.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* south* west*.

You follow Msanychta south...

[Bazaar Path.]

The going slows down briefly as someone stops dead in their tracks. Every so often one feels the need to take in the sounds and smells that are uniquely the Bazaar. Any slow down in the movement of the crowd creates a loud string of curses. The sellers are eager to get to market to get rid of their goods, and the buyers anticipate their purchases.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Msanychta south...

[Bazaar Path.]

The muffled noises you hear drifting in from the west come out of the Bazaar itself, a veritable hive of activity day and night. An occasional exotic smell is carried by the breeze to tantalize the nose. A large etched window displays tastefully dressed mannequins of many races.  An open sturdy mahogany door and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Msanychta south...

[Bazaar Path.]

Further passage along Bazaar Path is blocked occasionally by brawling peasants. Fights break out over who got here first, who gets to sell first, whose goods are better and who should just pack up and leave. When guards are forced to leave their posts to settle the arguments, all involved lose.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st drunk bar patron.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Msanychta south...

[Bazaar Path.]

Many people crowd the narrow Bazaar Path, either heading towards the infamous Bazaar, or forcing their way back towards Trade Way. For a small price, a farmer can rent a booth and directly market his goods. Both some of the best and some of the worst deals can be made within this collection of stalls. The tall wall of Spur looms high to the east, and many of the guards take an early peek into the carts and the goods coming to market.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Msanychta south...

[Trade Way, Intersection.]

A path to the north winds its way among various stalls and tents. Some specialty outlets can be found, provided one does not get lost in this maze known as the Bazaar. More permanent structures to the south suggest finer goods as well as increased security.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* east* south* west*.

You follow Msanychta west...

[Trade Way.]

This well-worn road separates the Bazaar to the north and Market Circle to the south. Only a Thugian could appreciate the layered odors of simmering foodstuffs and shoppers from the Bazaar. Crowds of people push past, some brushing against you. It might be a good idea to keep an eye on your coinpurse.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: east* west*.

You follow Msanychta west...

[Trade & Market.]

The buildings of Market Circle stand to the south. It becomes obvious that the area through the arch is a much cleaner marketplace than the bazaar. An inviting eatery stands beside the road, its door open to those weary after a long trip to Spur, as well as those preparing to venture to the great expanses beyond the west gate. A human couple exit the building, arm in arm. A small sign stands beside the intersection.  A sign, an open glossy lacquered oak door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: east* south* west*.

You follow Msanychta south...

[Market Street.]

Situated between the well-traveled Trade Way to the north and the fine shops of Market Circle to the south, this small stretch of road is busy at all times of day. Adventurers with sacks of plundered goods leave Market Street and head west where a shrewd businessman has set up shop in this busy area of the Market District. A small shop stands slightly to the east of the arch leading into Merchant Circle, light shining through its red glass door and illuminating the store front in a cheerful, ruby glow.  A street lantern, an opaque ruby red glass door, and a gold lettered wooden sign are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* south* west*.

Msanychta says, "perhaps I will come bother you when the peddles start..."

You follow Msanychta south...

[Market Street.]

Market Street ends here at a large archway. People bustle in and out of the arch, some without so much as a nod. The city wall rises up to the south and west of the buildings of Market Circle. A small sign is posted on the wall beside the archway.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: north*.

[Side Street.]

A large building sits on this side street. It is sturdily constructed from wood and brick, and bears a sign reading, "Rurik's Trading Post." Various objects line the window display ranging from weapons and armor to random objects you've never seen before. Insistent bartering goes on at all hours.   A pair of open double applewood doors and a street lantern are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious exits: east*.

You follow Msanychta through a pair of open double applewood doors...

[Rurik's Trading Post.]

An Usil trader sits in a corner with a small lamp cataloging and appraising the various items he has deemed fit to buy.  The cluttered shelves are piled so high it's a wonder he can keep track.  You carefully make your way through the armor, weapons and assorted sundries, to the counter.   A pair of open double applewood doors are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious exits: None.

[Side Street.]

A large building sits on this side street. It is sturdily constructed from wood and brick, and bears a sign reading, "Rurik's Trading Post." Various objects line the window display ranging from weapons and armor to random objects you've never seen before. Insistent bartering goes on at all hours.   A pair of open double applewood doors and a street lantern are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious exits: east*.

You follow Msanychta east...

[Market Street.]

Situated between the well-traveled Trade Way to the north and the fine shops of Market Circle to the south, this small stretch of road is busy at all times of day. Adventurers with sacks of plundered goods leave Market Street and head west where a shrewd businessman has set up shop in this busy area of the Market District. A small shop stands slightly to the east of the arch leading into Merchant Circle, light shining through its red glass door and illuminating the store front in a cheerful, ruby glow.  A street lantern, an opaque ruby red glass door, and a gold lettered wooden sign are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st drunk bar patron and the 2nd drunk bar patron.

You follow Msanychta south...

[Market Street.]

Market Street ends here at a large archway. People bustle in and out of the arch, some without so much as a nod. The city wall rises up to the south and west of the buildings of Market Circle. A small sign is posted on the wall beside the archway.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: north*.

You follow Msanychta through an archway...

[Market Circle.]

An arch between two large buildings connects Market Circle and Market Street. The more reputable shopkeepers do business within the circle, but pay higher taxes for the privilege. The buildings have been built to last, as these merchants are no traveling tinkers. Interlocking stone walkways and colorful plantings span this central area. Despite the number of animals waiting outside the bank for their owners, the area is spotless. Loud chatter in many languages can be heard from the southwest.  A marble archway, an open elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, and a wooden sign are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

You follow Msanychta through an open elegant gold-trimmed walnut door...

[Bank.]

The quiet hum of business fills your ears as you enter the Market Circle branch of the Rasnian Bank.  A long wooden desk at the far end of the room contains many tellers waiting to help you with your banking needs.  An open elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, a bright wooden sign, and a shimmering gold coin are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st governor's dread knight.
In the room is Msanychta the Drake.

[Trade & Market.]

The buildings of Market Circle stand to the south. It becomes obvious that the area through the arch is a much cleaner marketplace than the bazaar. An inviting eatery stands beside the road, its door open to those weary after a long trip to Spur, as well as those preparing to venture to the great expanses beyond the west gate. A human couple exit the building, arm in arm. A small sign stands beside the intersection.  A sign, an open glossy lacquered oak door, and a street lantern are here.

[Trade Way.]

This well-worn road separates the Bazaar to the north and Market Circle to the south. Only a Thugian could appreciate the layered odors of simmering foodstuffs and shoppers from the Bazaar. Crowds of people push past, some brushing against you. It might be a good idea to keep an eye on your coinpurse.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.

[Trade Way, Intersection.]

A path to the north winds its way among various stalls and tents. Some specialty outlets can be found, provided one does not get lost in this maze known as the Bazaar. More permanent structures to the south suggest finer goods as well as increased security.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.

You follow Msanychta east...

[Trade Way.]

Many townsfolk pass along this busy thoroughfare. Rich and poor alike mix freely on this street, much to the dismay of a passing nobleman. A young human struggles with an armful of packages and two young children in tow. Those in need of goods or supplies head west towards the market, those looking for the news of the day head east towards Town Square.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: east* west*.

You follow Msanychta east...

[Trade Way.]

A large gate separates the Merchant District and Town Square-the hub of Spur's activity. The partially opened gate is currently able to accommodate the simultaneous passage of several locals and visitors, but can be expanded to accept carriages, or sealed to ward against invasion.  Guards stand sentry from atop the wall as well as the ground.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: west*.

You follow Msanychta through an open stone gate...

[Merchant Walk.]

Merchant Walk comes to an abrupt end at a massive moonsilver gate. The towering walls of Spur on either side of the gates force all to pass by the guards who are constantly on the watch for thieves and bandits. Just beyond the gates one can glimpse the bustling Merchant District of Spur.  A gilded oak sign and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: east*.

You follow Msanychta east...

[Merchant Walk.]

Several city guardsmen have just finished wrestling to the ground some young tough thieves, who thought to rob one of the returning merchants. To one side a relieved-looking Fir Elf gentleman holds on tightly to his gold-tipped walking stick, as the human boy yells his innocence to any who might listen. His pleas fall on deaf ears as the guards drag him away.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: east* west*.

You follow Msanychta east...

[Merchant Walk.]

Merchants, some in frilly finery, others dressed in homespun wools, travel back and forth along this street on their way to and from work. They seem to blend together here, if only briefly. Several of the more haughty looking merchants are trailed by overloaded carts pushed along by haggard young apprentices.   A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st city guard archer and the 2nd city guard archer.

[Merchant Walk.]

A neatly kept park fronts this portion of Merchant Walk. Topiary and low shrubberies partition off small sections of the park. Young lovers sit on benches almost hidden from view, gazing at each other with looks of love, oblivious to the continual bustle of passing customers and merchants on their way to do business.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.

[Merchant Walk.]

Neatly trimmed shrubbery line well-maintained cobblestones along Merchant Walk. Apprentices rush by carrying supplies and orders, carrying out their masters' business. Several wooden benches line the walk for those customers who need to rest from the strain of carrying heavy parcels.  A street lantern is here.

This room is illuminated.

[Town Square West.]

People carrying bundles stream in from the west and rapidly lose themselves in the large crowds moving about in the vast town square. Several citizens head west with bulging coinpurses babbling excitedly about what they're going to purchase. Giggling children dart around the slower moving folks rushing on their way to spend the silvers in their pockets.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.

[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.  A flowing white marble fountain, a marble statue of a Human, a shimmering marble statue of a Dragon, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a rosewood sign, and a crisp gold lettered vellum notice are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st old busybody.
In the area is Msanychta the Drake.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

>[Town Square South.]

s
The outward appearance of the people here seems a bit classier. Rich clothing and large coin purses are prevalent amongst the travelers. In fact, many of the folk heading into Town Square from the south are accompanied by large bodyguards to assure their safety. The well maintained road is lined with small brass lanterns, each swinging off an individual pole.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.

[Southern Avenue.]

Smooth stones make up the street that leads from the center of Spur to the south. Each stone has been carefully fitted for the most comfortable travel by both cart and traveler alike. A well dressed Guard patrols the area in his dress uniform. Captains don't allow for slovenly appearances on this patrol.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

[Southern Avenue.]

Southern Avenue leads between the center of Spur and the homes of the prosperous and wealthy. Several of the Ladies of the city stroll along the avenue chatting about the current events and latest gossip of the Spur. Behind them, harried servants carry their reticules and all those belongings that they cannot be without.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.

[Southern Avenue.]

Vast estates tower over the huge Spurian wall towards the south. The well-to-do who live in these homes idle away their days, enjoying the luxury of time. Standing next to a very empty lantern pole, a small Flerian child insists in a plaintive wail, that he had nothing to do with the missing lantern. The well-dressed guard that interrogates him keeps pointing at a small sack on the ground and its obvious contents.  An open small burlap sack, a street lantern, and a lantern are here.

 ** Current hit points: 123 out of 129
[Southern Avenue & Gorey Street.]

The boughs of a large apple tree hang over the well tended avenue. Below the beautiful tree stands a small fountain. Atop the fountain is an intricately carved Secian who appears to be dancing with the water as it splashes around her. Set in the marble base is a small plaque that reads, "For those who have gone before us." Many stand for a moment as they pass this way, giving thanks for the gift of life that is given by both the apple tree and the Secians of long ago. Large piles of dirt and broken stone lay on either side of the street as workmen ready the east and west alleys for expansion.  A street lantern, a closed Secian etched moonsilver door, a pair of open silver forged swinging doors, and a sign above the doors are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* east* south* west.
[Southern Avenue.]

Standing next to the large iron gate that separates the center of town from those of the elite class are several of the Spurian Guard. They are here to assist all who pass with the simple kindness of opening a gate, or the more important task of escorting those in need to the bank or market. A young looking cadet rubs wax into the stones of the city wall, his task is daunting, but one that will teach him discipline.  An open iron gate and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north*.
go gate
>[Gateway.]

An elegant, carved wooden sign hangs above the ornate gateway set into the massive wall that divides Spurs Noble District from the Town Square. You can make out city guardsmen peering down attentively at all that approach from their posts atop the imposing wall. They seem to take a greater interest in this part of town, though there does not seem to be anything threatening enough here to warrant such attention.  A street lantern, an open iron gate, and a gilded silver plaque are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: south*.

>[Noble Way.]

To the north, you can make out an ornately scrolled gateway set in the base of the imposing city wall. The refined roadway of Noble Way stretches out to the south. The cobblestones of the road are smooth and even. The attention to detail shown here is a dramatic change from some of the other parts of the city.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.

sw
An unusually large home, even for this part of town, lies off to the west. It seems as if one ambitious owner is slowly buying up the lots next to his and adding them to his own. Groundskeepers are at work in the surrounding gardens, trimming and raking, so intent on their work they do not bother to acknowledge the passing traffic on the road.  A street lantern is here.

>[Noble Way.]

Many grand, even ostentatious, homes line this stretch of Noble Way. Most of the residents here were fortunate enough to be born into the right families. Few that live in this area have ever actually had to work for a living. Glancing at the nameplates reveals many of the recognizable names of the Spur. Some of these names could almost be considered famous.  A street lantern is here.

[Noble Way.]

Noble Way continues to wind its way among the rather modestly sized, but elegant, homes of the Spur's successful. Many a peasant farmer may live in homes larger than these, but none can match the quality found here. A peaceful, luxurious feeling pervades this part of town; perhaps it is the drifting floral scents wafting from the well-tended gardens.  A closed elegant black iron gate and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Noble Way.]

Gazing down each of the nearby private drives reveals a glimpse of a luxurious home, each a miniature estate in its own right. Short, stout walls and manicured hedges serve to keep out the riffraff and to protect the small, expensive gardens. Every detail has been attended to display the exotic plants, in all their pampered perfection.  A street lantern and a closed rosewood door are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* southeast*.
[Noble Way.]

Leaving the exceptionally wealthy estates of the Spurian nobility, Noble Way heads toward the Town Square to the northwest. Along the roadside can be seen the in-city homes of successful merchants and other wealthy citizens of the Spur. The homes display a slightly different style, perhaps they are not quite so restrained; a touch more exuberance and freedom with materials is displayed.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: southeast* northwest*.
[Intersection.]

The avenue comes to a fork, with Noble Way curving from south to the northwest. A side-street heading off to the east leads to an extremely well kept neighborhood that easily surpasses everything around it in splendor and magnificence. Everything, even the carefully pruned trees and the manicured shrubbery displays a desire for elegant perfection.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* south* northwest*.

>[Side street.]

Perfectly trimmed mature elms line this street, towering over your head and sheltering the meticulously kept cobble roadway. An impressively massive private estate crouches imposingly from beyond a well-guarded gateway on the north side. A few well-dressed gardeners can be glimpsed through the vine-bedecked gate. Not surprisingly, even the groundskeepers are stylish in their matching uniforms.  An open iron gate and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Side street.]

Numerous guards, some stationary at their posts, some patrolling the endless hedgerows, display the vast wealth and power behind the few widely spaced gates along this road. It is clear from the road the guards are all heavily armed and armored with only the best equipment. It would be safe to assume they are quite experienced and highly trained as well.  A street lantern and an open engraved black steel gate are here.

>[Lowengraf Mansion Grounds.]

A large mansion looms up before you. Immense oak double doors are carved with fine detail, depicting the rather intimidating countenances of a wolf and a lion. Two obsidian sconces reside on either side of the doors, yet they are in excellent condition, as if they have never even been lit. A rather large expanse of grass is bisected by two paths, one leading to the household, and one to the east towards a large copse of of trees.  Some closed intricately carved oak double doors and an open engraved black steel gate are here.

>[Lowengraf Wood.]

A small worn path leads its way through a rather dark copse of trees. Twisted branches form a barrier to bar any light that might filter down from the sky. Leaves crunch beneath your feet breaking the eerie silence. No creatures make a sound, a strange occurrence for such a verdant piece of land.

This area is illuminated.

>[Lowengraf Cottages.]

Two small stone cottages sit side by side.  The two cottages were built with high, narrow windows and thick stone walls.  Black doors have been set deep within the thick stone walls.  A closed shadowy black stone door and a closed shadowy black stone door are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: west*.
w
>[Lowengraf Wood.]

A small worn path leads its way through a rather dark copse of trees. Twisted branches form a barrier to bar any light that might filter down from the sky. Leaves crunch beneath your feet breaking the eerie silence. No creatures make a sound, a strange occurrence for such a verdant piece of land.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* west*.
w
>[Lowengraf Mansion Grounds.]

A large mansion looms up before you. Immense oak double doors are carved with fine detail, depicting the rather intimidating countenances of a wolf and a lion. Two obsidian sconces reside on either side of the doors, yet they are in excellent condition, as if they have never even been lit. A rather large expanse of grass is bisected by two paths, one leading to the household, and one to the east towards a large copse of of trees.  Some closed intricately carved oak double doors and an open engraved black steel gate are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: east*.

[Lowengraf Mansion Grounds.]

A large mansion looms up before you. Immense oak double doors are carved with fine detail, depicting the rather intimidating countenances of a wolf and a lion. Two obsidian sconces reside on either side of the doors, yet they are in excellent condition, as if they have never even been lit. A rather large expanse of grass is bisected by two paths, one leading to the household, and one to the east towards a large copse of of trees.  Some closed intricately carved oak double doors and an open engraved black steel gate are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: east*.
go gate
>[Side street.]

Numerous guards, some stationary at their posts, some patrolling the endless hedgerows, display the vast wealth and power behind the few widely spaced gates along this road. It is clear from the road the guards are all heavily armed and armored with only the best equipment. It would be safe to assume they are quite experienced and highly trained as well.  A street lantern and an open engraved black steel gate are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* west*.
e
>[Side street.]

The street ends abruptly at a shadowed gateway. The walls adjoining the gate have started to crumble due to the stress put on them by neglect and time. However, they do manage to conceal the looming estate within. The gate itself, though still functional, has fallen into a state of disrepair. The air is different, stale, and a certain coldness seems to linger upon the sudden wind, regardless of the weather. It must be the wind making that mournful moaning sound.  A wooden sign, an open black iron gate, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: west*.
go gate
>[Overgrown walkway.]

Tall weeds and brush almost obscure a small walkway that leads to what was once a magnificent home. In need of desperate repair this multistoried mansion has seen better days. Damaged woodwork, peeling paint, and broken windows mar what may have once been a beautiful facade. Rending the air with a shrill squeak, a rusted iron gate swings back and forth in the wind hanging precariously from its hinges.  An open rusted iron gate is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east.
e
>[Front porch.]

Creaking steps lead onto a porch that wraps around the width of the house. Magnificent oak doors, that bear the emblem of a flaming lion on it, allow entrance into this dilapidated home. On closer inspection, the initials "S.E." have been carved into the grainy oak.  An open oak door is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north south west*.
>
 ** Current fatigue: 70 out of 72
go door
[Entryway.]

The smell of rotting wood is strong in the entryway of the house. Your movements have caused some of the dust to rise. As it settles, you notice other older looking footprints that cross over each other time and time again. Two suits of armor with crossed halberds guard an archway to the east. The arch itself has the flaming lion engraved into it.  An open oak door, an open wooden door, an open mahogany door, an archway, and a stairs are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.
go ar
>[Long dark hallway.]

Looking to the west, you feel your feet become rooted to the floor. Is it just you or did the halberds held by those empty suits of armor move? Glancing around nervously, you look for an exit in this poorly lit hallway, and hope that it is not in the direction of the armor.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: east.
e
>[Long dark hallway.]

This end of the hallway is colder and darker than the western end; even lighting more torches would not improve this condition. A soft melody drifts through the second doorway. Perhaps you should see who or what is playing such a lovely tune.  An open black door and an open black door are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: west*.
go 2 doo
>[Reception.]

Bowing as you enter, a skeleton in a tuxedo takes your coat and waves you over to a podium where a feather quill rises in the air and scribes your name in a gold-leafed book.   Unsettling music drifts in from the east.  An open black door, an open pink door, an open blue door, a marble stairs, and a black leather couch are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: east* south*.
e
>[Entry hall.]

Before you stands a magnificent staircase descending into a spacious ballroom which is alive with activity and sound. A short zombie in a fine suit announces your arrival and silence settles over the crowd as all heads turn towards you.  Some giant golden marble stairs, a plush velvet carpet, and a porcelain vase are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: west*.

>[Hallway.]

Dark liquid drips down the walls of this hallway, leaving rusty colored streaks on the torn, once elegant wallpaper. Oddly, the liquid seems to vanish before reaching the floor, as there do not appear to be any pools of it. A chilled breeze whisks through, bringing with it a fetid smell. There is a persistent scratching noise coming from somewhere ahead. There is a door in the eastern wall.  A green glob of ectoplasm is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: west.

[Master bedroom.]

The master bedroom has an exquisitely designed tiled path leading up to a wash basin and an unbroken full-length mirror. The design in the tile is a lion walking in some tall grass. >[Master bedroom.]

The master bedroom has an exquisitely designed tiled path leading up to a wash basin and an unbroken full-length mirror. The design in the tile is a lion walking in some tall grass. The mirror itself is a work of art. The gilded gold frame shows a pride of lions in different scenes of hunt and play. s
>[Master bedroom.]

Against the south wall a canopied bed still stands, the remnants of its silk canopy nothing but tattered strips dangling down from a rusted wire frame. A figure lies in the bed, "asleep" for a long time now. Cobwebs stretch between the poles of the bed shrouding its occupant. A small, gold flaming lion statue sits on the dresser beside the bed. It is one of the few things of value that remain in the house.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: north* east.
e
>[Closet.]

The closet contains the moth eaten remains of what once was a fine wardrobe for a lord and lady. An ornate oak rack stands next to the closet door; at one time it must have held ornamental sabers. Someone has scrawled the letters "XJS" on one of the walls.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: west*.
w

>[Secret Library.]

A set of shelves line one of the paneled walls, barren of whatever it held before. Not even a layer of dust can be found on the shelves or the floor, as if the maids still clean this room. Strangely glowing arcane symbols are engraved in the marble floor, flaring briefly as you pass over them. 

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: north.
n
>[Secret Library.]

A bloodstained vivisection table rests in the center of the room, next to a small tray holding several scalpels, razors, saws, and probes. A moth-eaten quill hovers over a pedestal, the tome for recording notes long gone. Exotic alchemy apparatuses sit on shelves next to jars of colored powders and noxious liquids, ready for experimentation. 

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: northeast south* northwest.
ne
>[Secret Library.]

The charred remains of countless books litter the floor, and scorch marks marr the wood shelves set into the walls. A blackened desk sits in one corner, the heat from the fire that nearly consumed it causing a web-like lattice of cracks in the marble floor. 

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: north southwest* west.
n
n
>[Secret Library.]

One rack of books sits against the wall, protected from the ravages of time by a faintly glowing magickal barrier. Torn pages and mangled books are scattered everywhere, the broken remains of shelves showing deep scars from powerful claws. Piles of ash mark the spots where some books were burned, the knowledge contained in them perhaps lost forever. 

This room is illuminated.

A reading desk near the center of the room sits abandoned, the inkwells long dry and the sheets of parchment for notes crumbled to dust.   An open pretty cloth sack is here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st skeleton and the 2nd skeleton.
Obvious exits: north east southeast.
>
The 2nd skeleton swings a short wickedly hooked iron staff at you!
The swing is a decent blow to the left arm.
  Your heavy polished steelwood mail absorbs about half of the damage!
h
    Your left arm takes 3 points of slash damage!

You have no apparent injuries, but look weakened and tired.

A bloodstained vivisection table rests in the center of the room, next to a small tray holding several scalpels, razors, saws, and probes. A moth-eaten quill hovers over a pedestal, the tome for recording notes long gone. Exotic alchemy apparatuses sit on shelves next to jars of colored powders and noxious liquids, ready for experimentation.

[Secret Library.]

One rack of books sits against the wall, protected from the ravages of time by a faintly glowing magickal barrier. Torn pages and mangled books are scattered everywhere, the broken remains of shelves showing deep scars from powerful claws. Piles of ash mark the spots where some books were burned, the knowledge contained in them perhaps lost forever. 

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: south* west northwest.
nw
>[Secret Library.]

The black marble walls are covered with runes and sigils, some glowing while others seem to move and change shape before your eyes. The pentagram carved in the floor glows faintly, pulsing in time to some unknown rhythm.   An arcane pentagram, a fire blackened crystalla ball, and an open baggy canvas pouch are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: southeast* southwest.

>[Secret Library.]

>[Secret Library.]

A set of shelves line one of the paneled walls, barren of whatever it held before. Not even a layer of dust can be found on the shelves or the floor, as if the maids still clean this room. Strangely glowing arcane symbols are engraved in the marble floor, flaring briefly as you pass over them.   A green glob of ectoplasm is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: north.

l
[Secret Library.]

A set of shelves line one of the paneled walls, barren of whatever it held before. Not even a layer of dust can be found on the shelves or the floor, as if the maids still clean this room. Strangely glowing arcane symbols are engraved in the marble floor, flaring briefly as you pass over them. 

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: north.
n
>[Secret Library.]

A bloodstained vivisection table rests in the center of the room, next to a small tray holding several scalpels, razors, saws, and probes. A moth-eaten quill hovers over a pedestal, the tome for recording notes long gone. Exotic alchemy apparatuses sit on shelves next to jars of colored powders and noxious liquids, ready for experimentation. 

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: northeast south* northwest.
ne
>[Secret Library.]

The charred remains of countless books litter the floor, and scorch marks marr the wood shelves set into the walls. A blackened desk sits in one corner, the heat from the fire that nearly consumed it causing a web-like lattice of cracks in the marble floor.   A short wickedly pointed brass ice pick is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: north southwest* west.
>
You expend 1 fatigue keeping up the righteous globe on yourself.

The sphere of light about you dims and fades away.
n
[Secret Library.]

One rack of books sits against the wall, protected from the ravages of time by a faintly glowing magickal barrier. Torn pages and mangled books are scattered everywhere, the broken remains of shelves showing deep scars from powerful claws. Piles of ash mark the spots where some books were burned, the knowledge contained in them perhaps lost forever. 

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st lesser wight.

Torn pages and mangled books are scattered everywhere, the broken remains of shelves showing deep scars from powerful claws. >[Secret Library.]

The black marble walls are covered with runes and sigils, some glowing while others seem to move and change shape before your eyes. The pentagram carved in the floor glows faintly, pulsing in time to some unknown rhythm.   An arcane pentagram, a fire blackened crystalla ball, an open baggy canvas pouch, and a short wickedly hooked iron staff are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: southeast* southwest.

sw
[Secret Library.]

Flames consumed nearly everything in this room, leaving only the skeletal remains of shelves and bookbindings. Clouds of dust and ash billow into the air as you move through the room, obscuring what little you can see. 

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: northeast* east south.
s
>[Secret Library.]

Ancient tomes, yellowing scrolls, and dusty books fill the shelves that line the walls of this room. A ghostly figure can be seen moving along the shelves, searching for the book that will free his soul from the torment of undeath. A reading desk near the center of the room sits abandoned, the inkwells long dry and the sheets of parchment for notes crumbled to dust. 

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: north* east southeast.

Exotic alchemy apparatuses sit on shelves next to jars of colored powders and noxious liquids, ready for experimentation. 

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: northeast south northwest*.
s
>[Secret Library.]

A set of shelves line one of the paneled walls, barren of whatever it held before. Not even a layer of dust can be found on the shelves or the floor, as if the maids still clean this room. Strangely glowing arcane symbols are engraved in the marble floor, flaring briefly as you pass over them. 

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: north*.
go pan
>[Secret room.]

You step through the cloudy mirror into a secret room. Old books and papers are stacked everywhere. A dirty, but usable, cot lies in the corner next to an overstuffed chair. Even with all the dust covering it, the chair looks very comfortable.  A hidden panel is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.
>
 ** Current fatigue: 68 out of 72

This room is illuminated.

[Master bedroom.]

Against the south wall a canopied bed still stands, the remnants of its silk canopy nothing but tattered strips dangling down from a rusted wire frame. A figure lies in the bed, "asleep" for a long time now. Cobwebs stretch between the poles of the bed shrouding its occupant. A small, gold flaming lion statue sits on the dresser beside the bed. It is one of the few things of value that remain in the house.

This room is illuminated.

[Secret Library.]

The charred remains of countless books litter the floor, and scorch marks marr the wood shelves set into the walls. A blackened desk sits in one corner, the heat from the fire that nearly consumed it causing a web-like lattice of cracks in the marble floor. 

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: north southwest* west.
n
>[Secret Library.]

One rack of books sits against the wall, protected from the ravages of time by a faintly glowing magickal barrier. Torn pages and mangled books are scattered everywhere, the broken remains of shelves showing deep scars from powerful claws. Piles of ash mark the spots where some books were burned, the knowledge contained in them perhaps lost forever. 

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: south* west northwest.
nw
>[Secret Library.]

The black marble walls are covered with runes and sigils, some glowing while others seem to move and change shape before your eyes. The pentagram carved in the floor glows faintly, pulsing in time to some unknown rhythm.   An arcane pentagram and a fire blackened crystalla ball are here.

This room is illuminated.

[Hallway.]

Dark liquid drips down the walls of this hallway, leaving rusty colored streaks on the torn, once elegant wallpaper. Oddly, the liquid seems to vanish before reaching the floor, as there do not appear to be any pools of it. A chilled breeze whisks through, bringing with it a fetid smell. There is a persistent scratching noise coming from somewhere ahead. There is a door in the eastern wall.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: west.

[Top of stairs.]

The squeaks coming from the floor are the only sounds one can hear upstairs. A long dark hallway stretches out in front of you. Cobwebs and an overwhelming amount of dust are stirred at your every movement. Several doors down the hallway lead into bedrooms.  Some stairs are here.

This room is illuminated.

>[Entryway.]

>[Secret alcove.]

The wind whistles through a broken pane of the small, barred window. The view from the window is barren, yet it is freedom. Behind a tattered tapestry is a small door that leads to the west.  A stairs, a short ice cold iron hand axe, and an open dirty doeskin bag are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.

>[Master bedroom.]

sk
A crooked desk against the north wall has a large stack of papers on it. The slight breeze stirred by your entering the room causes them to crumble to dust. On the east wall is a tapestry depicting a stern, dark haired man wearing red, orange and brown.

This room is illuminated.

s
>[Master bedroom.]

The master bedroom has an exquisitely designed tiled path leading up to a wash basin and an unbroken full-length mirror. The design in the tile is a lion walking in some tall grass. The mirror itself is a work of art. The gilded gold frame shows a pride of lions in different scenes of hunt and play.  An open door is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: north* south.
go mir
>[Secret room.]

You step through the cloudy mirror into a secret room. Old books and papers are stacked everywhere. A dirty, but usable, cot lies in the corner next to an overstuffed chair. Even with all the dust covering it, the chair looks very comfortable.  A hidden panel is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.
go pan
>[Secret Library.]

A set of shelves line one of the paneled walls, barren of whatever it held before. Not even a layer of dust can be found on the shelves or the floor, as if the maids still clean this room. Strangely glowing arcane symbols are engraved in the marble floor, flaring briefly as you pass over them. 

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: north.
n
>[Secret Library.]

A bloodstained vivisection table rests in the center of the room, next to a small tray holding several scalpels, razors, saws, and probes. A moth-eaten quill hovers over a pedestal, the tome for recording notes long gone. Exotic alchemy apparatuses sit on shelves next to jars of colored powders and noxious liquids, ready for experimentation. 

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: northeast south* northwest.
ne
>[Secret Library.]

The charred remains of countless books litter the floor, and scorch marks marr the wood shelves set into the walls. A blackened desk sits in one corner, the heat from the fire that nearly consumed it causing a web-like lattice of cracks in the marble floor. 

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: north southwest* west.
n
>[Secret Library.]

One rack of books sits against the wall, protected from the ravages of time by a faintly glowing magickal barrier. Torn pages and mangled books are scattered everywhere, the broken remains of shelves showing deep scars from powerful claws. Piles of ash mark the spots where some books were burned, the knowledge contained in them perhaps lost forever. 

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: south* west northwest.
nw
>[Secret Library.]

The black marble walls are covered with runes and sigils, some glowing while others seem to move and change shape before your eyes. The pentagram carved in the floor glows faintly, pulsing in time to some unknown rhythm.   An arcane pentagram and a fire blackened crystalla ball are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: southeast* southwest.
sw
>[Secret Library.]

Flames consumed nearly everything in this room, leaving only the skeletal remains of shelves and bookbindings. Clouds of dust and ash billow into the air as you move through the room, obscuring what little you can see. 

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: northeast* east south.
s
>[Secret Library.]

Ancient tomes, yellowing scrolls, and dusty books fill the shelves that line the walls of this room. A ghostly figure can be seen moving along the shelves, searching for the book that will free his soul from the torment of undeath. A reading desk near the center of the room sits abandoned, the inkwells long dry and the sheets of parchment for notes crumbled to dust. 

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st zombie.
Obvious exits: north* east southeast.
>

>[Master bedroom.]

The master bedroom has an exquisitely designed tiled path leading up to a wash basin and an unbroken full-length mirror. The design in the tile is a lion walking in some tall grass. The mirror itself is a work of art. The gilded gold frame shows a pride of lions in different scenes of hunt and play.  An open door is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: north south.
s
e
>[Master bedroom.]

Against the south wall a canopied bed still stands, the remnants of its silk canopy nothing but tattered strips dangling down from a rusted wire frame. A figure lies in the bed, "asleep" for a long time now. Cobwebs stretch between the poles of the bed shrouding its occupant. A small, gold flaming lion statue sits on the dresser beside the bed. It is one of the few things of value that remain in the house.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: north* east.
[Closet.]

The closet contains the moth eaten remains of what once was a fine wardrobe for a lord and lady. An ornate oak rack stands next to the closet door; at one time it must have held ornamental sabers. Someone has scrawled the letters "XJS" on one of the walls.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: west*.
w

l
>[Master bedroom.]

The master bedroom has an exquisitely designed tiled path leading up to a wash basin and an unbroken full-length mirror. The design in the tile is a lion walking in some tall grass. The mirror itself is a work of art. The gilded gold frame shows a pride of lions in different scenes of hunt and play.  An open door is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: north south.
>
 ** Current fatigue: 63 out of 72
s
[Master bedroom.]

e
Against the south wall a canopied bed still stands, the remnants of its silk canopy nothing but tattered strips dangling down from a rusted wire frame. A figure lies in the bed, "asleep" for a long time now. Cobwebs stretch between the poles of the bed shrouding its occupant. A small, gold flaming lion statue sits on the dresser beside the bed. It is one of the few things of value that remain in the house.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: north* east.
>[Closet.]

The closet contains the moth eaten remains of what once was a fine wardrobe for a lord and lady. An ornate oak rack stands next to the closet door; at one time it must have held ornamental sabers. Someone has scrawled the letters "XJS" on one of the walls.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: west*.
w

>[Master bedroom.]

sk
A crooked desk against the north wall has a large stack of papers on it. The slight breeze stirred by your entering the room causes them to crumble to dust. On the east wall is a tapestry depicting a stern, dark haired man wearing red, orange and brown.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: south*.

>[Secret alcove.]

The wind whistles through a broken pane of the small, barred window. The view from the window is barren, yet it is freedom. Behind a tattered tapestry is a small door that leads to the west.  A stairs is here.

go mir
>[Secret room.]

You step through the cloudy mirror into a secret room. Old books and papers are stacked everywhere. A dirty, but usable, cot lies in the corner next to an overstuffed chair. Even with all the dust covering it, the chair looks very comfortable.  A hidden panel is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.
go pan
>[Secret Library.]

A set of shelves line one of the paneled walls, barren of whatever it held before. Not even a layer of dust can be found on the shelves or the floor, as if the maids still clean this room. Strangely glowing arcane symbols are engraved in the marble floor, flaring briefly as you pass over them. 

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: north.
n
>[Secret Library.]

A bloodstained vivisection table rests in the center of the room, next to a small tray holding several scalpels, razors, saws, and probes. A moth-eaten quill hovers over a pedestal, the tome for recording notes long gone. Exotic alchemy apparatuses sit on shelves next to jars of colored powders and noxious liquids, ready for experimentation. 

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: northeast south* northwest.
ne
>[Secret Library.]

The charred remains of countless books litter the floor, and scorch marks marr the wood shelves set into the walls. A blackened desk sits in one corner, the heat from the fire that nearly consumed it causing a web-like lattice of cracks in the marble floor. 

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: north southwest* west.
n
>[Secret Library.]

One rack of books sits against the wall, protected from the ravages of time by a faintly glowing magickal barrier. Torn pages and mangled books are scattered everywhere, the broken remains of shelves showing deep scars from powerful claws. Piles of ash mark the spots where some books were burned, the knowledge contained in them perhaps lost forever. 

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: south* west northwest.
nw
>[Secret Library.]

The black marble walls are covered with runes and sigils, some glowing while others seem to move and change shape before your eyes. The pentagram carved in the floor glows faintly, pulsing in time to some unknown rhythm.   An arcane pentagram and a fire blackened crystalla ball are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: southeast* southwest.
sw
>[Secret Library.]

Flames consumed nearly everything in this room, leaving only the skeletal remains of shelves and bookbindings. Clouds of dust and ash billow into the air as you move through the room, obscuring what little you can see. 

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st skeleton.
Obvious exits: northeast* east south.

Ancient tomes, yellowing scrolls, and dusty books fill the shelves that line the walls of this room. A reading desk near the center of the room sits abandoned, the inkwells long dry and the sheets of parchment for notes crumbled to dust. 

This room is illuminated.

>[Secret room.]

You step through the cloudy mirror into a secret room. Old books and papers are stacked everywhere. A dirty, but usable, cot lies in the corner next to an overstuffed chair. Even with all the dust covering it, the chair looks very comfortable.  A hidden panel is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.

go mir
[Master bedroom.]

The master bedroom has an exquisitely designed tiled path leading up to a wash basin and an unbroken full-length mirror. The design in the tile is a lion walking in some tall grass. The mirror itself is a work of art. The gilded gold frame shows a pride of lions in different scenes of hunt and play.  An open door is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: north south.

>[Hallway.]

Dark liquid drips down the walls of this hallway, leaving rusty colored streaks on the torn, once elegant wallpaper. Oddly, the liquid seems to vanish before reaching the floor, as there do not appear to be any pools of it. A chilled breeze whisks through, bringing with it a fetid smell. There is a persistent scratching noise coming from somewhere ahead. There is a door in the eastern wall.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: west.

The squeaks coming from the floor are the only sounds one can hear upstairs. A long dark hallway stretches out in front of you. Cobwebs and an overwhelming amount of dust are stirred at your every movement. Several doors down the hallway lead into bedrooms.  Some stairs are here.

This room is illuminated.

go st
[Entryway.]

The smell of rotting wood is strong in the entryway of the house. Your movements have caused some of the dust to rise. As it settles, you notice other older looking footprints that cross over each other time and time again. Two suits of armor with crossed halberds guard an archway to the east. The arch itself has the flaming lion engraved into it.  An open oak door, an open wooden door, an open mahogany door, an archway, and a stairs are here.

[Overgrown walkway.]

Tall weeds and brush almost obscure a small walkway that leads to what was once a magnificent home. In need of desperate repair this multistoried mansion has seen better days. Damaged woodwork, peeling paint, and broken windows mar what may have once been a beautiful facade. Rending the air with a shrill squeak, a rusted iron gate swings back and forth in the wind hanging precariously from its hinges.  An open rusted iron gate is here.

This area is illuminated.

[Side street.]

The street ends abruptly at a shadowed gateway. The walls adjoining the gate have started to crumble due to the stress put on them by neglect and time. However, they do manage to conceal the looming estate within. The gate itself, though still functional, has fallen into a state of disrepair. The air is different, stale, and a certain coldness seems to linger upon the sudden wind, regardless of the weather. It must be the wind making that mournful moaning sound.  A wooden sign, an open black iron gate, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Side street.]

Perfectly trimmed mature elms line this street, towering over your head and sheltering the meticulously kept cobble roadway. An impressively massive private estate crouches imposingly from beyond a well-guarded gateway on the north side. A few well-dressed gardeners can be glimpsed through the vine-bedecked gate. Not surprisingly, even the groundskeepers are stylish in their matching uniforms.  An open iron gate and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* west*.
[Intersection.]

The avenue comes to a fork, with Noble Way curving from south to the northwest. A side-street heading off to the east leads to an extremely well kept neighborhood that easily surpasses everything around it in splendor and magnificence. Everything, even the carefully pruned trees and the manicured shrubbery displays a desire for elegant perfection.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* south* northwest*.
nw
>[Noble Way.]

Leaving the exceptionally wealthy estates of the Spurian nobility, Noble Way heads toward the Town Square to the northwest. Along the roadside can be seen the in-city homes of successful merchants and other wealthy citizens of the Spur. The homes display a slightly different style, perhaps they are not quite so restrained; a touch more exuberance and freedom with materials is displayed.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: southeast* northwest*.

>[Noble Way.]

n
Gazing down each of the nearby private drives reveals a glimpse of a luxurious home, each a miniature estate in its own right. Short, stout walls and manicured hedges serve to keep out the riffraff and to protect the small, expensive gardens. Every detail has been attended to display the exotic plants, in all their pampered perfection.  A street lantern and a closed rosewood door are here.

[Noble Way.]

Noble Way continues to wind its way among the rather modestly sized, but elegant, homes of the Spur's successful. Many a peasant farmer may live in homes larger than these, but none can match the quality found here. A peaceful, luxurious feeling pervades this part of town; perhaps it is the drifting floral scents wafting from the well-tended gardens.  A closed elegant black iron gate and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Noble Way.]

Many grand, even ostentatious, homes line this stretch of Noble Way. Most of the residents here were fortunate enough to be born into the right families. Few that live in this area have ever actually had to work for a living. Glancing at the nameplates reveals many of the recognizable names of the Spur. Some of these names could almost be considered famous.  A street lantern is here.

[Noble Way.]

An unusually large home, even for this part of town, lies off to the west. It seems as if one ambitious owner is slowly buying up the lots next to his and adding them to his own. Groundskeepers are at work in the surrounding gardens, trimming and raking, so intent on their work they do not bother to acknowledge the passing traffic on the road.  A street lantern is here.

[Noble Way.]

To the north, you can make out an ornately scrolled gateway set in the base of the imposing city wall. The refined roadway of Noble Way stretches out to the south. The cobblestones of the road are smooth and even. The attention to detail shown here is a dramatic change from some of the other parts of the city.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.

[Gateway.]

An elegant, carved wooden sign hangs above the ornate gateway set into the massive wall that divides Spurs Noble District from the Town Square. You can make out city guardsmen peering down attentively at all that approach from their posts atop the imposing wall. They seem to take a greater interest in this part of town, though there does not seem to be anything threatening enough here to warrant such attention.  A street lantern, an open iron gate, and a gilded silver plaque are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: south*.
go gate
>[Southern Avenue.]

Standing next to the large iron gate that separates the center of town from those of the elite class are several of the Spurian Guard. They are here to assist all who pass with the simple kindness of opening a gate, or the more important task of escorting those in need to the bank or market. A young looking cadet rubs wax into the stones of the city wall, his task is daunting, but one that will teach him discipline.  An open iron gate and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north*.
n
>[Southern Avenue & Gorey Street.]

n
The boughs of a large apple tree hang over the well tended avenue. Below the beautiful tree stands a small fountain. Atop the fountain is an intricately carved Secian who appears to be dancing with the water as it splashes around her. Set in the marble base is a small plaque that reads, "For those who have gone before us." Many stand for a moment as they pass this way, giving thanks for the gift of life that is given by both the apple tree and the Secians of long ago. Large piles of dirt and broken stone lay on either side of the street as workmen ready the east and west alleys for expansion.  A street lantern, a closed Secian etched moonsilver door, a pair of open silver forged swinging doors, and a sign above the doors are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* east* south* west.
n
>[Southern Avenue.]

Vast estates tower over the huge Spurian wall towards the south. The well-to-do who live in these homes idle away their days, enjoying the luxury of time. Standing next to a very empty lantern pole, a small Flerian child insists in a plaintive wail, that he had nothing to do with the missing lantern. The well-dressed guard that interrogates him keeps pointing at a small sack on the ground and its obvious contents.  An open small burlap sack, a street lantern, and a lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Southern Avenue.]

Southern Avenue leads between the center of Spur and the homes of the prosperous and wealthy. Several of the Ladies of the city stroll along the avenue chatting about the current events and latest gossip of the Spur. Behind them, harried servants carry their reticules and all those belongings that they cannot be without.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st townsman and the 2nd townsman.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

n
>[Southern Avenue.]

Smooth stones make up the street that leads from the center of Spur to the south. Each stone has been carefully fitted for the most comfortable travel by both cart and traveler alike. A well dressed Guard patrols the area in his dress uniform. Captains don't allow for slovenly appearances on this patrol.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Town Square South.]

The outward appearance of the people here seems a bit classier. Rich clothing and large coin purses are prevalent amongst the travelers. In fact, many of the folk heading into Town Square from the south are accompanied by large bodyguards to assure their safety. The well maintained road is lined with small brass lanterns, each swinging off an individual pole.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* south* west* northwest*.
[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.  A flowing white marble fountain, a marble statue of a Human, a shimmering marble statue of a Dragon, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a rosewood sign, and a crisp gold lettered vellum notice are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.
w
>[Town Square West.]

People carrying bundles stream in from the west and rapidly lose themselves in the large crowds moving about in the vast town square. Several citizens head west with bulging coinpurses babbling excitedly about what they're going to purchase. Giggling children dart around the slower moving folks rushing on their way to spend the silvers in their pockets.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st city guard mage and the 2nd city guard mage.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* west*.
w
w
>[Merchant Walk.]

Neatly trimmed shrubbery line well-maintained cobblestones along Merchant Walk. Apprentices rush by carrying supplies and orders, carrying out their masters' business. Several wooden benches line the walk for those customers who need to rest from the strain of carrying heavy parcels.  A street lantern is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: east* west*.

[Merchant Walk.]

A neatly kept park fronts this portion of Merchant Walk. Topiary and low shrubberies partition off small sections of the park. Young lovers sit on benches almost hidden from view, gazing at each other with looks of love, oblivious to the continual bustle of passing customers and merchants on their way to do business.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* west*.

w
[Merchant Walk.]

Merchants, some in frilly finery, others dressed in homespun wools, travel back and forth along this street on their way to and from work. They seem to blend together here, if only briefly. Several of the more haughty looking merchants are trailed by overloaded carts pushed along by haggard young apprentices.   A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* west*.
[Merchant Walk.]

Several city guardsmen have just finished wrestling to the ground some young tough thieves, who thought to rob one of the returning merchants. To one side a relieved-looking Fir Elf gentleman holds on tightly to his gold-tipped walking stick, as the human boy yells his innocence to any who might listen. His pleas fall on deaf ears as the guards drag him away.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* west*.
[Merchant Walk.]

Merchant Walk comes to an abrupt end at a massive moonsilver gate. The towering walls of Spur on either side of the gates force all to pass by the guards who are constantly on the watch for thieves and bandits. Just beyond the gates one can glimpse the bustling Merchant District of Spur.  A gilded oak sign and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.

>[Trade Way.]

A large gate separates the Merchant District and Town Square-the hub of Spur's activity. The partially opened gate is currently able to accommodate the simultaneous passage of several locals and visitors, but can be expanded to accept carriages, or sealed to ward against invasion.  Guards stand sentry from atop the wall as well as the ground.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: west*.

>[Trade Way.]

Many townsfolk pass along this busy thoroughfare. Rich and poor alike mix freely on this street, much to the dismay of a passing nobleman. Those in need of goods or supplies head west towards the market, those looking for the news of the day head east towards Town Square.  A street lantern is here.

[Trade Way.]

This well-worn road separates the Bazaar to the north and Market Circle to the south. Only a Thugian could appreciate the layered odors of simmering foodstuffs and shoppers from the Bazaar. Crowds of people push past, some brushing against you. It might be a good idea to keep an eye on your coinpurse.  A street lantern is here.

[Trade & Market.]

The buildings of Market Circle stand to the south. It becomes obvious that the area through the arch is a much cleaner marketplace than the bazaar. An inviting eatery stands beside the road, its door open to those weary after a long trip to Spur, as well as those preparing to venture to the great expanses beyond the west gate. >[Market Street.]

Situated between the well-traveled Trade Way to the north and the fine shops of Market Circle to the south, this small stretch of road is busy at all times of day. Adventurers with sacks of plundered goods leave Market Street and head west where a shrewd businessman has set up shop in this busy area of the Market District. A small shop stands slightly to the east of the arch leading into Merchant Circle, light shining through its red glass door and illuminating the store front in a cheerful, ruby glow.  A street lantern, an opaque ruby red glass door, and a gold lettered wooden sign are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south* west*.
[Side Street.]

A large building sits on this side street. It is sturdily constructed from wood and brick, and bears a sign reading, "Rurik's Trading Post." Various objects line the window display ranging from weapons and armor to random objects you've never seen before. Insistent bartering goes on at all hours.   A pair of open double applewood doors and a street lantern are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: east*.
[Rurik's Trading Post.]

An Usil trader sits in a corner with a small lamp cataloging and appraising the various items he has deemed fit to buy.  The cluttered shelves are piled so high it's a wonder he can keep track.  You carefully make your way through the armor, weapons and assorted sundries, to the counter.   A pair of open double applewood doors are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.

>[Market Street.]

Situated between the well-traveled Trade Way to the north and the fine shops of Market Circle to the south, this small stretch of road is busy at all times of day. Adventurers with sacks of plundered goods leave Market Street and head west where a shrewd businessman has set up shop in this busy area of the Market District. Obvious paths: north* south* west*.
[Market Street.]

Market Street ends here at a large archway. People bustle in and out of the arch, some without so much as a nod. The city wall rises up to the south and west of the buildings of Market Circle. A small sign is posted on the wall beside the archway.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north*.
go door
[Market Circle.]

An arch between two large buildings connects Market Circle and Market Street. The more reputable shopkeepers do business within the circle, but pay higher taxes for the privilege. The buildings have been built to last, as these merchants are no traveling tinkers. Interlocking stone walkways and colorful plantings span this central area. Despite the number of animals waiting outside the bank for their owners, the area is spotless. Loud chatter in many languages can be heard from the southwest.  A marble archway, an open elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, and a wooden sign are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.
bank bal
[Bank.]

The quiet hum of business fills your ears as you enter the Market Circle branch of the Rasnian Bank.  A long wooden desk at the far end of the room contains many tellers waiting to help you with your banking needs.  An open elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, a bright wooden sign, and a shimmering gold coin are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st governor's dread knight.
Obvious exits: None.

The teller whispers to you, "You have an account balance of 4806 silver."

>[Merchant Walk.]

Merchant Walk comes to an abrupt end at a massive moonsilver gate. The towering walls of Spur on either side of the gates force all to pass by the guards who are constantly on the watch for thieves and bandits. Just beyond the gates one can glimpse the bustling Merchant District of Spur.  A gilded oak sign and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east*.
e
e
[Merchant Walk.]

Several city guardsmen have just finished wrestling to the ground some young tough thieves, who thought to rob one of the returning merchants. To one side a relieved-looking Fir Elf gentleman holds on tightly to his gold-tipped walking stick, as the human boy yells his innocence to any who might listen. His pleas fall on deaf ears as the guards drag him away.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* west*.
[Merchant Walk.]

Merchants, some in frilly finery, others dressed in homespun wools, travel back and forth along this street on their way to and from work. They seem to blend together here, if only briefly. Several of the more haughty looking merchants are trailed by overloaded carts pushed along by haggard young apprentices.   A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* west*.
[Merchant Walk.]

A neatly kept park fronts this portion of Merchant Walk. Topiary and low shrubberies partition off small sections of the park. Young lovers sit on benches almost hidden from view, gazing at each other with looks of love, oblivious to the continual bustle of passing customers and merchants on their way to do business.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.

>[Merchant Walk.]

Neatly trimmed shrubbery line well-maintained cobblestones along Merchant Walk. Apprentices rush by carrying supplies and orders, carrying out their masters' business. Several wooden benches line the walk for those customers who need to rest from the strain of carrying heavy parcels.  A street lantern is here.
